May 8 2009 	Mostly good - inspect your room first	Negatives:When we first arrived, our room still had some trash in it that housekeeping missed. Worst of all, a wet, dirty washcloth was left in the tub. We promptly changed rooms. They supposedly "upgraded" us by putting us in a "high floor" room, but the view wasn't as good of the strip. However, the view to the mountains was great, so we stayed. The room had a very strong and distinct marijuana smoke smell when we first walked in. But we just dealt with it because we were ready to hit the casino. By the next day it was gone. We later discovered that the walls are PAPER thin and we not only heard the neighbors next to us very clearly, but during the day, since our room overlooked the pool, the pool music was very loud and crystal clear coming into the room. We felt the consierges could have been more knowledgable (eg: WE knew that Wynn golf was now open to the public, and they didn't) as well. The beds were a tad too firm and the bathroom is extremely small.Positives:Location, location, location - excellent location! All of the staff were very nice and did try hard to accomdate our needs and answer our questions. The rates were fantastic compared to other hotels on the strip and it's still a nice enough place where we didn't feel that we were settling (too much). Once we were moved, the room seemed very clean (except the smell, and I think the carpets could use a good shampooing). The breakfast buffet was AWESOME and totally worth the money. We didn't try lunch or dinner. The fast food court came in handy for quick cheap meals on the run. The water pressure in the shower ROCKED!All in all, we would stay there again and we had a good time.

May 7 2009 	Excellent Excellent Excellent	After reading all the bad reviews I am telling you this I am a very picky person but the Monte Carlo is Excellent in every way. There were no surprizes for us. We had seven rooms booked for a trip to the Grand Canyon, a family of nineteen and we had teen agers a one year old and a three year old. You do not have to walk through the caniso to get to your rooms. and the pool area is great, they honored all of our request for seven non smoking rooms away from the construction sight., The linens were clean and the towels and wash cloths are of top quality. we travel a lot and I would say this is one of the best we have stayed at. Do not believe all the bad reviews. I am christian and I would not miss lead you. The Monte Carlo is a excellent choice. We were there from May 2 to May 5 and check in and out was fast. Great Hotel, give it a try and you will be on here writing a good review also. 10 stars for the Monte Carlo and the construction is almost done and the lobby was spotless we had the breakfast buffet and it is right up there with the one in Hawaii. Great choices and the food is terrific. and it was only 12.88 a person and with a lot of choices a nd we loved It. you can eat there cheaper than the mcdonalds and it is better for you health wise

May 5 2009 	Pleasantly surprised	We stayed for three nights April 26 - 29 and were pleasantly surprised. The check in and out was a breeze as we were able to use the "invited guest check in" due to a comp for our room. We were in a deluxe room which room was clean, somewhat updated and had a very comfortable bed (I was surprised). The first night we stayed in a room with 2 queens, although we requested a king. However they indicated we could move to a king room the next day. The only problem with this was trying to occupy our room which finally happened around 4:00 p.m. and after my husband stood in the invited guest line for at least 45 minutes. The line only had a couple people, however they kept calling people over from the other lines. Needless to say, my husband was very frustrated! I guess we shouldn't complain as we were getting the room for free. so to speak.The bathroom was bigger than, say, New York, New York, but not as big as TI and Mandalay Bay.We loved the food court, my husband had a large breakfast at Sbarro every morning, brought my coffee and hash browns up to the room for me, and enjoyed the guacamole and chips at Rubios.Even though we don't like buffets in general, we had the lunch buffet on our last day and the price was around $30 (?) total. I enjoyed a "made to order" Philly Cheese Steak and thought it was something different than the usual made to order pasta etc.The casino is a bit dated (we stayed there shortly after it opened), but easy to navigate and had large aisles.We went out to the pool one day and the only complaint I have is that none of the beverage servers made it over to our area. I went to the pool bar and bought a double rum & coke and Malibu & diet for $33. The cups were probably 12 oz. Weather was high 70's, lower 80's. The crowds weren't bad, a sign of the times.I must say that the staff was friendly and nice compared to the staff at New York, New York when we were there in Oct 2008.We didn't eat at any of the other hotel restaurants, so I cannot comment there.

May 5 2009 	Worst Experience in Vegas EVER!!!	We go to Vegas about twice a year and have stayed a many of the MGM Mirage properties. We almost always go to the pool and have never had such a horrible experience. First of all REALLY loud music at the pool started around 9am, so sleeping late was not an option. When we arrived at the pool there were no open seats, and hardly any room to walk for the matter. After waiting in line for 20 minutes for expensive drinks (its vegas expensive drinks are to be expected) we found out that the tube we rented for our 12 year old son was stolen from him by an adult male, not another child. A while later when we tried to use the replacement tube, we were splashed mercilessly by a bachelor party until my $20 drink was filled with pool water. This all happens as the lifeguard watches and laughs. I asked him to stop them or replace my drinks, he says he is helpless and talk to a manager. I do and the manager is also helpless and has to go get the General Manager of the pool. I never complain, but people were way out of hand touching other people and their belongings. while i am waiting in the wave pool for the GM to come talk to me a drunk man from a bachelor party jumps on my tube and tries to take it from me. I wrestle the tube away and yell at him and the man tries to punch me in the face. I am a woman by the way. Security comes, huge scene, nothing is done. They stand there staring at me and let him get away. Everyone on the whole property is helpless. The only thing i received after all of this were the free drinks i requested. Our child and parents were traumatized and the day ruined. No other comps were given even after further complaining about the out of control nature at the pool. We come to vegas a lot and go to some of the rowdier pools including club rehab at the hard rock and mandalay bay which is VERY busy. Nothing like this has EVER happend to us before. No one has ever even bothered us...even at CLUB REHAB- the wildest party on the strip! Never stay at the Monte Carlo unless you are just going to be in the casino the whole time, that was the only good part. We were woken up again sunday morning by a loud speaker making announcements for a wedding party at 8am. Stay at the Mirage, Mandalay Bay, the Paris instead- this was one of the worst guest service experiences of my life. I used to work in guest services...I don't complain unless something is very wrong and I NEVER write these reviews, the experience was just THAT bad.

May 5 2009 	Pretty darn good place to stay	First time at this hotel, apprehensive considering the many poor reviews. The good: fast checkin and out, friendly staff, no construction noise, clean large room and bath, good convenient location, fast valet service, good food at the cafe, lively casino area. The bad?: tired room decor, some noise from neighboring rooms, slow shower drain, awful buffet, ridiculous internet access fees and poor tv station options.Overall for the price and location, a very good value (except for Sat nite stay which was over priced due to the Championship fight in town).The worst buffet prime rib ever. Nearly the worst bbq ribs, inedible. No wonder no lines on a friday nite. Should've gone to Brand the streakhouse.Overall, definitely will consider for our next stay.

May 4 2009 	Don't waste your money or time	With all the hype about Las Vegas - we thought we were in for a great little 4 day get away! Boy, were we disappointed! I don't think we will ever plan another trip there and if we do, we sure won't stay at the Monte Carlo. We spent a lot of money there and the comps are terrible. We ended up getting 2 buffets a piece and we ate at the dinner buffet once while we were there and it was comparable to a Luby's, but twice the price. Taking advantage of our comped buffets when we checked out almost took an act of congress. The people at the players club are very inexperienced and every time you want to know about your comps they have to get on the phone to some secretive "marketing" person. The front desk is just as bad - they can't tell you anything about your comps. Therefore everyone is sending you running around from desk to desk.The rooms are okay, but don't expect fresh towels daily and don't expect coffee in the morning when you wake up. Unless you pay the outrageous price for room service coffee or go downstairs and purchase coffee from McDonald's or Starbucks. Another thing - bring your own sodas or water with you to the room because there are no complimentary bottles of water left in your room and the soda machine on at least 2 floors that we checked was taped up and out of order! After going to two floors looking for a soda machine that worked, we just gave up and went back to our room.They did not have wifi internet access. You had to plug into an ethernet port and then that did not even work. You could access the internet by PAYING a $5 minimum at a little public kiosk in their lobby. If you want to print your boarding passes from there they charge you another $1 per page!!!!The slots were so tight that we did not see anyone winning anything. We spent a lot of money and playtime in their casino and it was crap.My advice: don't go. If you want to go to an excellent hotel/casino that knows how to treat their patrons and don't want to travel to Las Vegas, try L'auberge du lac in Lake Charles, LA. It is a gorgeous hotel and casino, great staff, friendly people, wonderful food, and complimentary beverage bars in the casino for sodas, water, and coffee.

May 4 2009 	Not Great	First, I'm a huge fan of MGM Mirage properties. Having said that...Room needs a major update and a good cleaning. Bedding is at Holiday Inn-levels, which is surprising.Bathroom is pretty bad. Not clean, amenities are not what they should be, towels are worn out and bath is unappetizing. The shower lever barely works.Pool is crammed with lounge chairs because of the construction right next to it, so probably not the best experience.PROS: Not a huge hotel to walk through and elevators are right off the lobby. Lobby area looks nice. Great mid-Strip location.

May 3 2009 	Fine but for the pool.	While I acknowledge that enjoying a quiet moment reading by the pool isn't the first thing most people look forward to when planning a trip to Vegas, it can provide a welcome respite from clanging slot machines. Just not at the Monte Carlo. There is not a single square yard of the sizable pool area that is not assaulted by loudspeakers pumping in hip hop music at a high volume. Reading or relaxing poolside is utterly impossible as MC tries to create some sort of "party atmosphere" at all hours--even before noon. I've got no problem with hip hop nor with nurturing a "pool party" atmosphere for the guests who love that stuff, but surely MC could set aside a section of its pool area for guests who value a little peace and quiet for a while and who do not address one another as "dude".

May 2 2009 	Never again...	this hotel has so much potential, but fails miserably.my first complaint was the pool! on of the deciding factors for staying here was the incredible pool. my wife and i managed to hang out for all of 15 minutes! the DJs were probably the worst i have EVER heard! its not that i dislike techno, i dont...but just because you have software that will match two beats together, this does not make you a good DJ!!!this crap started around 9am and went until 6pm.the construction eyesore SUCKED! it true vegas style, someone decided to build8, yes count them 8, structures on the same site...right next door to the hotel! work was going 24/7, with the real noise starting at 6am!the restaurants suck royally. i think that the only place open aside from the fast food joints was that brew pub, and the insanely over priced steakhouse. and speaking of the fast food, who ever would have thought that any Subway restaurant ANYWHERE would actually charge 12$ for a sandwich.the casino drinks were watered down and almost non alcoholic, tonic water was always substituted with flat club soda/sour mix. when you actually ordered a drink from the bar it was 9$.i was pretty much blown away by what they try to charge for stuff here. i expect hotel convenience stores to be a bit over priced, and having been to vegas probably 10 times prior, i expect 'vegas pricing'. however, on this trip i was truly dumbfounded at how ridiculous las vegas businesses have gotten in charging their customers the insulting prices they actually get away with.and so with this trip i bid farewell to las vegas forever. let the coked up yuppies from LA have it.

May 1 2009 	Best deal on the strip	Room was very nice and comfortable. Bathroom was large and accommodating. Very clean. Staff was courteous and helpful. Pool was fun even for adults, we loved the lazy river with its self propelling current. It was almost as good as being at the beach. We enjoyed the poolside bar and drinks were allowed in the lazy river. We got awesome pictures to take home with us. We left our personal belongings at our lounge chairs without any problems. Thanks you Monte Carlo for a "Girls Weekend" we will never forget. Love your deals for rooms on a budget while still getting all the value of a full-priced stay.

May 1 2009 	Lovely hotel - great base for stay in Las Vegas	I'm a little surprised by some of the reviews for the Monte Carlo having just stayed there. Having said that we did not go to Vegas to sit by a pool all day - it was our first visit and we're out and about each day. If you are going to relax then yes it's probably not ideal - from the little I saw of the pool area it did seem cramped and there is a buidling site looming over. However it was purely a base for us.We had a great view of the strip. Our room was very clean and comfortable with two big beds and a great shower. The rest of the hotel was very clean with the usual casino, food court, restaurant and buffet places. We liked the fact that although it had all this - as it was not particularly a themed hotel it was better and a bit more of an escape from the others.The staff were very helpful and very well organised - especially in the buffet section - almost military! We only ate in the buffet for breakfast and once for dinner and it was excellent food and value.The building site next door did take the wow factor off the strip a bit and it would be unfortunate if you were looking out onto it.We thought the hotel was good value, comfortable and good location as it sits pretty much in the middle of the main hotels. Las Vegas itself is amazing although very tiring and if you are going to site see rather than relax - although the hotels are themed differently they are all pretty much the same format. If you like loads of gambling and shopping then Vegas is for you!

May 1 2009 	Very nice stay	Stayed in Vegas frm 4/27-4/30 & got a great rate of $47.06/night!! How can you pass that up in this economic time! First time at this location & thought it was very nice. The room is clean, the bed comfortable. It's shows a little wear but that's fine. Update w/flat screens, and a plug for cellphone by the desk would help but there is a laptop wire/jack available. Check in/desk service was pleasant & courteous, housekeeping was very good. Food court w/Starbucks, Sbarro, some chinese place is there and the Cafe is open 24hrs, is very good. (Food court at the Venetian is better.) Did not eat at Diablos or the French restaurant or swim in the pool. The gambling tables were fine, there's a lot of penny & nickel slots which was fun.I recommend getting the bus passto get around town on the "Deuce". The 24 hr pass is $7 or a 3 day pass @ $15 & can be purchased right on the bus. Unlimited rides during the time frame!! Well worth the price since one bus ride is $3. And since the buses on "the Strip" are double decker, go up the stairs to get a view of the night life. The bus stops right in front of the hotel when coming fromthe Fremont (north) direction but to head back that way, you have to get to the front of the MGM to catch the bus.They say Vegas is not doing so well since conventions/conventioneers are down & the economy is bad, but there sure seemed to be a lot of people!! It felt like the same Vegas to me!Also, allow extra time for your shuttle pick up to the airport. Allowed an extra 1/2 hour but since there were so many hotel stops, it got late. What ever they tell you when you place your call for pickup, add 30 mins.Overall, this is a 3.5 rating.

Apr 29 2009 	A good time despite construction work	I agree with previous comments regarding construction work which very much impacted on an otherwise good hotel. The pool area is indeed 'packed like sardines' and the level of music noise is at times disturbing to say the least., particularly if you want a rest after a night gambling and drinking which is a part of a vegas holiday for us. Also because of building work there is a limit to the sunshine at the pool which is again very nice but people are therefore struggling to find sunbeds and it felt more like being in the med with attempts to reserve beds in the better areas. The dust from the construction site was indeed a pest and overall we were disappointed with the sunshine element of this holiday. The hotel areas - rooms, buffet and casino are nice; very clean, with excellent service but could perhaps do with a lick of paint and updating. All this said we did have a good holiday. However I would be cautious for the future regarding the pool and limits to the sun.

Apr 29 2009 	Great Hotel for a cheap price	This hotel to me was kind of a hidden gem. I thought it was very elegant on the inside but very affordable. The rooms were nice and we never had a problem with noise or house keeping. There was a lot of construction going on next door so there was quite a bit of dust in the air but the noise was never a problem. The pools were packed with kids but still very nice. They have a small wave pool and lazy river which was really nice. We had no problems finding chairs and the adult pool is separate from the kids area. We managed to find a little kiddy pool tucked into a hidden area that was great for laying out in. Not many people came in and the water was shallow enough to sit in but still get sun. This hotel is in a great location, right next to New York, New York and across the street from Planet Hollywood. The restaurants are nothing special so I'd recommend going somewhere else to eat but they did have a nice little food court with a subway, starbucks, mcdonalds, sbarro's and some kind of chinese food. The only problem is that it closed early and if you were out looking for a late night snack after coming in from the bars you were out of luck. Occasionally the sbarro's would stay open late but the pizza was very limited and it was only open till 2:00.I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. My friends and I loved it and would deinitely go back.

Apr 29 2009 	A Poem on the Monte Carlo	My review of this hotel was that it was just so soBut it's not necessarily a bad place to go.What was nice was that there wasn't a casino that you need to walk through,but instead is a simple lobby and a few stores too.It's just a basic hotel if you need a place to crash,and you don't have to worry about spending a lot of cash.The pool was big and there was this lazy river to ride,but it was filled with people's suntan lotion as you rode the tide.The location was fine and not really out of the way,and it's a basic place-what more can I say.

Apr 28 2009 	Don't do it... words can't describe how they've ruined a great hotel	This was my fourth stay at the Monte Carlo over the past five years or so and I was really looking forward to it. It's always been good value, it's a great location and while it can't offer good bars and restaurants like other strip hotels it has a solid quality to it that has always appealed. And my wife and I loved relaxing out by the excellent pool..... until now.As we neared the colossal building site loomed into view, engulfing the hotel on three sides in noise, dust and site traffic. But not to worry, that's not really the hotel's fault. Our room was decent enough and we were checked in early. The windows were caked in dust from the site, rendering the extra paid for a view a little wasteful, but you don't go to Vegas to sit in your room, do you. We still weren't going to let such things bother us.But the gross mismanagement of this hotel became clear when we decided to hit the pool, which is an essential part of a Vegas stay. Much of the pool side terraces have been sold off to the building project and the remaining area sees sunbathers packed in like sardines between the various pools. But fortunately the management at the Monte Carlo have found a way to limit the number of people competing for space in the sun.The music around the pool is so loud and so awful that it destroys any notion of a relaxing lie out by the pool, reading or drinking. It is so loud it will literally make you feel sick. I wish I was joking.I'm no stranger to outdoor music festivals and rock concerts but have never heard a noise like it. I imagine they are trying to drown out the noise of the building site, but even still, it makes the pool totally off-limits. My wife and I like to gamble and have a fair few drinks of an evening and then crash out by the pool to recover. it's the only way to be in Vegas. But not so at the Monte Carlo, not any more it would seem.Worse still, not to sound too geriatric about this, but the music sounds like the creation of the manager's son who has begged his dad to let him play some of his mixes by the pool. It's truly appalling. The sort of thing you'd expect to hear if you bought a tone deaf nephew a set of decks for Christmas, played at a volume rivaled only by a Boeing 747 taking off.However... and this is a nice touch. If you looked to escape into to the Brew Pub for a bite of lunch, not only does it look like a canteen for the monstrous building site, covered in dust and littered with hard hats and high-visibility jackets, they also had a fire alarm which went off every 15 minutes for the duration of our stay. This was explained away as "it's nothing to worry about"... well, it is pretty annoying. Much like the way the Monte Carlo is now run.The accommodation and staff were pleasant and despite the MASSIVE building site, the location of the Monte Carlo remains outstanding. However, some basic but important failings mean this is a hotel I could never return to, even in a couple of years when the building work may finally be complete.We went on to the Luxor instead. Not ideal but in comparison it is sooo much better. However, if it wasn't for conferences filling many of the better hotels we would have gone for Caesars Palace which now is uncontested as my favourite Vegas hotel, where previously the Monte Carlo was snapping at its heels.

We chose to stay at the Monte Carlo out of all Vegas hotels, since we got a great deal and it was in a decent location on the strip. The hotel was very clean with an elegant decor. Apr 7 2009 	Just OK.	I stayed at the Monte Carlo for 3 days recently with my mother and 2 adolescent daughters. The lobby of the hotel is relatively impressive, and check-in was fairly painless. The room was not all that impressive. It was kind of small and a little dingy, though the bathroom was really nice. The beds were comfortable, except for the non-fitted sheets which did not want to stay on the mattress. I asked for a room away from the construction noise, and did not hear any of the construction noise while in my room, or elsewhere on the premises. I did hear noise from the adjoining rooms, and was awakened once around 4:00 a.m. by a couple of lovebirds in the room next door.The pool area is nice, though it was a bit too chilly for us to swim while there. I didn't spend a lot of time in the casino, so can't really comment on it. The food court was very handy considering we had kids with us. We had the buffet once, and it was very good, especially the desserts. Much better than the Excalibur's, which is the only other Vegas buffet I've tried. The biggest gripe I had is with the internet service. They advertise high speed internet for $14.99 a night. What I didn't learn until I got there was that that price is PER laptop (we had 3) and you can only use 1 laptop at a time, because it is not wireless. I ended up going with a service called Traveler's Wi-Fi, which was much cheaper, but I had a crappy connection the entire time I was there. There were probably better alternatives, but of course, I couldn't research them without an internet connection to begin with. I guess you don't go to Vegas to stay on the internet, but if that's something that's important to you, you might want to research it before you go. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, but definitely nothing to write home about.

We didn't get a chance to swim, but the pool area looked nice. I've stayed at other hotels in Vegas and would rate the Monte Carlo as my new favorite!

Mar 24 2009 	Beep beep beep beep...	We were awoken at 7:00 am on Saturday morning to the sounds of construction vehicles backing up(beep, beep) saws and hammering etc. The City Centre Complex is being built right next to the MC. We were able to change rooms and it was somewhat quieter on Sunday morning. However, by Monday construction was back in full swing and though it was somewhat quieter, we were still awoken early by the sounds of construction. Mar 22 2009 	pretty upscale for an inexpensive hotel off the strip	Room clean. Liked having a food court. Free parking for guests. Not too far off the strip and much nicer than I expeced for the money.

Mar 19 2009 	not bad not great	We stayed march 15-18th. The best part of the hotel is the casino and location. it was clean, not crowded and not too big. However, we play $15-$20 blackjack hands and they didn't even want your card unless you play at least $25 each hand. Other properties happily took our cards. the drink service was top notch 3 of the 4 days we were there and the dealers were all nice. the food court in the casino was also a plus. the weather was great which meant you had to be out early to get a chair. the pool area is TINY and there are not enough chairs and a lot of the area is shaded. the drink service at the pool was good. check in and out was very speedy. we asked to be away from the construction and that was honored. the room is just ok. we don't spend a lot of time there so that usually isn't an issue. the pillows they provide are the worst ones i have ever slept on by far. if they would provide better pillows, i would stay again if the price was really good.

Mar 18 2009 	Very comfortable.	Overall this is a great place to stay. Check in was a breeze. We arrived at noon and they had several rooms available immediately. We had a choice of pool view, strip view or mountain view. We opted for the pool view, but once we got into the room you could hear the noise of construction so we changed to a much quieter mountain view. You should ask about construction noise when checking in. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. I was nervious after reading a review aobut bed bugs. After careful inspection and 3 nights later, there were no signs of any bed bugs or any other bugs.We booked a stay and play package, good value but probably would have been better off taking the AAA rate. They offered $20.00 in food court coupons. Keep in mind these are not vouchers. You order something and you get a free pop or free tortia chips. Not much of a savings and you won't use all the coupons. It also came with 2 buffet vouchers. This is worth between $20 & $40 depending on the meal. The buffet was okay but you felt obligated to use them when there are so many other choices in Vegas.The food court was nice & reasonable. McDonalds, Pizza, Mexican, Chinese, Starbucks and Hagendaz. There is also a reasonably priced Pub and mexican restaurant Diablo's. Diablo's was always busy with $3.00 drink specials from 3-7p.m. Temperatures didn't allow us to enjoy the pool. We did take a walk to the pool. It is a very nice area with one main pool, a lazy river and a wave pool. We did enjoy the casino's. We don't spend a lot of money gambeling but we did enjoy the monopoly game. This casino seemed to have the best payouts. We couldn't win anything any where else. The main pool water was very chilly....not heated. Location was good. Walking distance to many of the main hotels, casino's and shows. Across the street was a 1/2 off ticket booth for shows. This had the shortest lines of the 3 boots. Don't go to the one next to the M&M store or Bills. Those lines were very long. I did learn that you don't get your "real" tickets here. Once you pay for your show you are directed to the venue where the show is to pick up your "real" tickets with seat assignment. This hotel isn't as plush as the Bellagio and the rooms aren't as big, but it is a very good value. If you are looking for the basic ammenities and not the most expensive restaurants and shops this is a great place to stay.

Mar 17 2009 	Not worth it	Stayed at the Monte Carlo recently. Check in went smooth, they had a gentleman directling traffic which helped expedite the process. We got to our room (22-231) and we were greatly dissappointed. My travel companion had stayed there before and swore she remembered a much nicer room. The room was generally worn out and in poor shape. The bathroom floor had something sticky on it and the bathtub drained slowly. No extras such as coffee maker, refridgerator, and the TV was circa 1995. Cigarette burns in the carpet, a hole in my sheet, and a whole 2 tiny drinking glasses to toast our surroundings. I felt really dissappointed considering other places I had stayed for a similar cost or less had much more to offer. I will compliment the casino floor for being not so busy and for availability of games. Drink service was fair. I receommend to all to order a beer. Mixed drinks were super weak. Although, we kept commenting on a smell that reminded us kitty litter on the gaming floor. Never did figure that smell out.

Mar 15 2009 	Monte Carlo does not disappoint	My brother and I just got back from a quick weekend in Las Vegas. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo before and decided to stay there again. I have stayed at several properties in Las Vegas and I continue to like the Monte Carlo. The resort is very clean and comfortable. It may not be a pristine as it once was, but it is definitely not run down in any way. The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful. All in all, it is a very nice property.I tried to take a shower one day at around 4pm and the shower was not working. I called maintenance and they said that they had a pipe burst and it would be fixed in 15 minutes. In 15 minutes it was in perfect working order. My only complaint would be that I decided to print up our boarding passes and used their business center. They charged me $4 for the 2 minutes on their computer. I felt like that was a little bit of a "nickel and dime" thing, but other then that I cannot say enough good things about this resort overall.It may not be the most "upscale" property on the strip, but I would not hesitate to stay here. I'm not sure I would select it as a place to take my significant other if I was really trying to impress her, but other then that caveat, I would be back in a heartbeat.

Mar 14 2009 	Average	The staff was generally okay. A few gems, and no one was outwardly rude. Rooms were less than average, and even though we asked to be placed away from the City Center construction, we had a front row seat. The noise wasn't as bad as we had heard, but the walls were way too thin. Every time someone in the hall opened or closed a door we jumped.The standard rooms were getting a little old and tired. The beds, pillows and bed coverings were not up to standard. Furnishings were worn. The bathroom was nothing special, but adequate.I would normally say the location was good, you had to navigate City Center construction. When it's over, I'm sure it will be fine.One item that bothered us was the how early the restaurants closed. At a quarter of ten, all were closed with the exception of the Cafe (which offered a VERY limited menu) and the food court. Only one restuarant even acknowledged us.The one restaurant we visited, Dragon Noodle, was very poor. That is another review, but trust me, stay away from it.The casino was well laid out. The games were a bit dated, but they had a good variety.Overall, I think you can do much better, expecially in this economy. And until the City Center project if completed, I would stay away.

Mar 11 2009	Darn good value	Two couples (over 50, but hip) spent a week in Vegas in February. We have stayed at the Monte Carlo before and were confident in doing so again. We were not disappointed since it proved to be the same value as in years past. The rooms were clean and while not the Ritz Carlton, they were just fine. The lobby is very pretty and we got some great deals on stuff at the gift shop. Look for the 50% off shelves. Our only gripe was the construction noise. There is a HUGE project going on at the rear of the hotel and those guys start really early. On check-in, be sure to ask for a room on the east side of the hotel. Be specific about wanting to be away from the noise. We felt that odd numbered rooms on any floor would not be directly adjacent to the racket. All in all, we had a great time and would stay there again.

Mar 10 2009 	Great Time at the Monte Carlo	We stayed at the Monte Carlo for four nights and enjoyed every minute of it! From the roomss to the staff everything was great. We did have the buffet for dinner one night and it was very nice, we also ate at Cafe and at the Brew Pub and did not have one bad meal. We will stay at this hotel again without a doubt,

Mar 9 2009 	Nothing Fancy But Good For The Price / 3.5 out of 5	In reading recent reviews I made sure to ask for a room not located facing all the construction and trust me you will want to do this to as the rooms are defintley not sound proof as we could hear the construction Thursday and Friday morning . Check in and check out were both very quick and efficent and the location on the strip is nice, not central but not total opposite end.If you get a good deal and really don't care about a themed looked to your hotel like say Luxor , then The Monte Carlo is not a bad option at all but next time I think I'll look for a fancier hotel. Mar 6 2009 	Not perfect but great value	My wife and I booked a trip to vegas from columbus ohio for 3 nights at the monte carlo. Mar 4 2009 	Great value!	Took advantage of the email rate and we were comped 3 of the 4 nights we stayed. Room was large with large bathroom. Very clean with good maid service. Check-in was quick and the lady checking us in was extremely helpful. Despite comments to the contrary, we found this place quiet (much more so than the Mirage). Machines were tight, but the casino is large and easy to get around. Will not eat at the Cafe again. We went for a late lunch and I ordered a simple salad and my wife ordered a sandwich. It took nearly 45 minutes, despite the fact few people were there. No apology even after asking the waitress where our food was. Food was no better than a salad at McDonalds. We needed a cab to get our rental car. bellhop said that this was a new cabbie, but he told him to just drive down Las Vegas Blvd. the the Fox car rental. When he turned right onto Tropicana Blvd, I asked why. he said that the freeway was quicker. Since it was 9 a.m. and the was no traffic, and only 3 traffic lights to go through, I questioned why. Well after getting off the freeway, he drove right past the rental place and then wanted to drive even further to turn around. He then drove us up to the entrance and expected us to get out and walk across the parking lot to the office. His credentials were not displayed on the dash as required. We were WAY overcharged. This was the trip from hell! The Monte Carlo should not be dealing with thiefs like this. I would absolutely stay at the Monte Carlo again, but would refuse to take another cabbie who is new. Incidentally, this was the only Mid-eastern cabbie we met out of about 6 cab rides.

Mar 3 2009 	What a waste of money	I was very disappointed with the Monte Carlo. We were told it was a four star...far from it. Mar 3 2009 	Fun Hotel with One Exception	I stayed at the Monte Carlo Hotel and Casino on March 2, 2009, with my wife, my brother and his wife. We were in town to see The Beatles Love at the Mirage. Overall I would give the Monte Carlo very positive reviews. I like the Monte Carlo because the casino is fairly small by strip standards and not so hard to find people or lengthy walks to get places. The casino was very nice, clean and very good drink service. The rooms were nice and clean. Diablos Cantina was a lot of fun during Happy Hour with crazy drink specials with the female bartender pouring wild shots while standing on the bar. My only complaint involved an incident at the Cafe and involves something that would have never happened in Vegas 15 years ago before the whole town went corporate. After we returned from the show at the Mirage we went for a quick bite to eat the Cafe before going to bed. While we were in the process of being seated the hostess had a fight with three servers right in front of our table over who was going to be our server. We waited for about 10 minutes and no one even brought water to our table or took our drink orders. If the cafe had been busy I would have understood, but it was close to 90% empty. I called over the hostess to ask if there was a problem and she said someone would be with us shortly. We waited a few more minutes and still no one came to our table to even bring us water, let along take our food order. I then complained rather sternly to the manager about what the problem was with the service. She informed me that if I did not calm down she was going to call security and have me removed. This despite the fact that we had been waiting for 15 minutes with no assurance we would get water let alone dinner. I told her this level of service was not acceptable and she told me that she would not speak to me until I calmed down. I saved her the trouble and our party just left the cafe. 15 years ago that would never have happened in Vegas and is now one of the reasons I go to Laughlin now rather than Vegas. 15 years ago that manager would have go to the kitchen themselves to get the water and probably comped our meals. But in these modern times where these corporate casinos have to squeeze every dime out of every possible source of cash in the hotels customer service has to take a hit. So instead of taking care of us, the manager was complete rude and disrepectful to me and probably cost her resturant $100 that night. In the grand scheme of things that doesn't matter to the Monte Carlo, but it demonstrates how much Las Vegas has changed and not for the better.

Mar 3 2009 	Much better than expected	We stayed here for the Valentine's weekend. It was much better than expected after reading some of these reviews and we would stay here again forsure! We got the deal from Westjet with 2 free buffets (AMAZING!), 2 drinks and 2 spa passes. We only used the buffet. We also got $10 slot money with the package on top of the $10 for signing up for the MGM card. (The casinos in Old Vegas only give free cards or entry forms for signing up.) The fast food places were ok, but a little expensive. The room was very nice (especially compared to Stratosphere), the service was great, and the casino had very loose slots. It was the only casino I won in. I also won the free trip to Cancun that the casino in Old Vegas draws each night, but the trip was not free. It would cost over $300 in taxes and fees. We asked for a room away from the construction and we got a room on the 27th floor. We did not hear a thing, and the beds were very comfy. We saw the V-Show after getting a cheap ticket from a timeshare promo. It was good for $10 but not worth a full price ticket. If you are going to see a show, but the tix for half price on the street. Just get in line early in the morning. We also went fishing in Lake Mead with a guide and it was AMAZING! We caught 23 fish in 5 hours. It is only 30min away from the strip. The wax museum was ok, but not really worth the price of the ticket and the aquarium at Mandalay Bay was not cheap but very good.We will definately stay at the Monte Carlo again. Our stay was great! Thanks!!

Mar 2 2009 	Nice but could be noisy	3 Night stay at a great price.Asked for a room away from construction which they obliged by putting us away from the major City Centre construction.However we still heard construction early from building works near New York New York so ask for a high room.Room was fine,beds comfortable but the walls are very thin and if you have a neighbour with a noisy child like us and you have jet lag it can be a problem.Loved the Brew Pub downstairs- nice atmosphere and good cheap specials.Casino had a nice atmosphere.Diablo restaurant out front was a little like a conveyor belt with the staff constantly rushing you through to serve the next eaters.The construction work next door also hinders walking up and down the strip as the sidewalk was closed at times causing much crossing over the busy road and extra steps.Also what is it with the people giving out the porn cards on the street .All in I would stay again but would probably wait a while until the construction is finished.

Mar 1 2009	Great location low-key hotel in middle of action	The Monte Carlo is a great value in a great location. It is safe and clean with nice amenities. The casino is bright and cheerful with a nice range of slots and tables.

Feb 28 2009 	Spa Suite Worth the Upgrade	My husband and I traveled to Vegas recently for a few days away. Upon our arrival we were booked in a standard room. Feb 27 2009 	Great deal	Spent 2 days of rest and relaxation at the MC. Got a great special that included drinks, fitness center, and buffet all included. Room was fine nothing special. I will say that I did have a good time in the casino, the cocktail remember my drink each night which is like old Vegas! Feb 26 2009 	Decent hotel but north end of strip is much nicer	We hadn't been to Vegas in 5 years. Went to see what was new & exciting. Truth is - not much. The hotel was fine - nothing special - but the construction going on around it (the Aria) was ridiculous. Trucks and banging starting at 4 a.m. Noisy!! No TV remote in our room and ill-fitting sheets, hard pillows, soft mattresses. Decent food court with a Starbucks, but the smell of smoke makes it impossible to sit and eat. We were on the 24th floor with views over the Strip.The rooms were quite big and nice and clean.The hotel was very central, plenty of places to eat.Lovely casino and shops. Feb 25 2009 	Great time!	Went for a long weekend and had a wonderful time. Great rates and location. Right next to New York New York, so was able to go to the Irish pub and have a great time!

Feb 20 2009 	Great Comps	We spent a long Valentine's weekend and were very happy with the hotel and it's services. Checked in around noon and got a room immediately. Room was clean and bed comfortable. I am a smoker and did find there wasn't much ventilation to get rid of the smoke. Window opened about 6" but that didn't help much and no exhaust fan in the bathroom. Also thought the bedspreads and carpet were outdated but I didn't expect (or pay the price of) the Wynn. We had a corner room and could still hear hall noise but never heard any construction noise. Shower was amazing. Feb 16 2009 	Perfect Getaway	My boyfriend and I stayed at the MC for the long weekend and we enjoyed it. Check in was a breeze and they gave us a room on a high floor. Not too many people checking in earlier in the afternoon was nice. The room was nice, it was a room with a connecting door but we hardly noticed. Only on one of the three nights we were there did we hear neighbors. View out the windows wasn't the greatest- it was on the construction, but we saw gorgeous sunsets all three nights. No fitted sheets on the beds, but I think that is common in most hotels on the strip. Location was perfect, we walked everywhere we went, never even thought to use the car. Casino didn't have as much traffic as the others so that was nice. Buffet brunch in the morning was great, had a lot of food and great selections. Free margaritas at Diablo's were welcomed and tasty, but when we wanted to eat at 10:30pm on a Sunday night, there kitchen was already closed so we had to go next door to the NYNY. No complaints about the room or anything like that, it was a great location, price, and room for the romantic getaway we were looking for!

Feb 16 2009 	Monte Carlo Just Fine (if you aren't picky and expecting the Wynn or Bellagio)	We (boyfriend & I) stayed at the Monte Carlo Feb 12-15th for a Valentine's getaway. Check-in was quick, we asked to be located away from the construction going on next door and they happily obliged. The room was standard and fine for us - clean and nice enough. Noise - We did hear construction the first night (a few bangs like they were moving steel) at about 4 am so it probably was very loud if you were on the construction side of the hotel but that was all we heard in 3 nights. We heard our neighbors once but then they were either quiet or never in their room...if you had noisy ones I suppose that could have been a problem but we were lucky. Casino - The casino is a little smokier than others but also a little quieter which was okay with me (we just went to the other hotels... we don't gamble much, maybe 2 hours total the whole trip).Food - We ate at the food court for breakfast the first morning and it was standard Starbucks (yes the prices are a little higher but what do you expect, if you want the cheaper prices you have to leave the hotel and go across the street to that food court - we were willing to pay a couple bucks more for the convenience). The second morning we went to the cafe...the "Ultimate Oatmeal" is good and huge enough for 2 people to easily share (maybe even 3 people) so we both ate for under $12. We had a free buffet and used it for dinner...not impressed with that. The food wasn't BAD but it also wasn't great or exciting (kind of like a college cafeteria level of food instead of a resort buffet level). If you had to pay for it, it wouldn't be worth it...go elsewhere. The pool was closed until March but they told us we can go next door to the Bellagio and use their pool/hot tub (for free). Check out was easy. Housekeeping was nice and I thought they did a fine job. Location is excellent (I was bummed that the tram to the Bellagio is gone because now you have to walk past all the construction to get there but it's still a good location) . Don't expect the Mirage, Bellagio or Wynn - type luxury here, I certainly wouldn't call it Motel 6...it's more a Holiday Inn/Doubletree level hotel. We thought it was a reasonable price, in a good location and a decent hotel.

We stayed at the Monte Carlo Feb. 5th-9th 2009 in room 9103 and everything was wonderful! We did ask for a room away from the construction going on next to the MC. Checking in and out was fast. The location is great. All of the staff were very nice and never rude. We enjoyed our stay so much at the MC, we will be returning this summer.

Feb 4 2009 	very nice hotel	I am staying at the monte carlo as we speak and I am quite pleased. My only advise would be to ask for a room on the south side to avoid the construction noise. Nice clean hotel though, no complaints...

Feb 3 2009 	Exceeded My Expectations	Due to numerous negative posts about the Monte Carlo I had set my expectations fairly low. However, I was very pleasantly surprised at my stay. The check-in was quick, friendly and accurate, and all the perks of the package I reserved were noted and offered.The room was very, very nice and the bathroom was roomy. Everything was clean and fresh in appearance and smell. The housekeeping staff restocked and refreshed the room very well each day.Yes, there is construction next door and they do work 24 hours a day. But I was never bothered by any noise whatsoever. Occassional banging or a horn were insignificant and would never prevent me from sleeping comfortably. I've got to assume it was more quiet and less bright than the flash of the Strip, had my room faced that direction.I will admit the walls are very thin and a noisy neighbor "could" be a problem very easily. I was fortunate that my neighbors were quiet so no problem there.The food was good at the restaurants and buffet, and even the food court would be great for someone who just wants to spend a couple bucks on food or a soda (even the McDonalds had a few items for $1).Didn't do terribly well on the slots at Monte Carlo, compared to other casinos, but that's Lady Luck, not the establishment so much.Checkout was efficient and accurate.All in all, I would definitely stay at Monte Carlo again. Previous negative reports are helpful but remember that some people only see the bad side of everything. There is definitely very little "bad" about the Monte Carlo so don't be afraid at all.

Apr 20 2004	Flea pit!!!!	As a UK visitor I can easily say - quite simply the worst hotel - rooms, staff even 'free' coffee and donuts - all absolutley awful. Great Stay at Ny NY	From check in to check out we had a fab time at Ny Ny - the location is not as central as some of the hotels we've stayed at but we new this before we booked. We had a great room (newly refurbished) on a relatively low floor but the view was unimportant and the casino and bars were all great fun. Great casino with great people - but don't stay at the hotel	I arrived Thanksgiving day from San Diego, needed a family getaway (or should I say get away from family :-) I booked on priceline and put in $90 for a four star or better hotel, so I didn't have a lot of choice on which hotel, when the price came back as NY NY. I had read the previous reviews online, but wanted to come here with an open mind, prepare for the worst and hope for the best! Arriving at the hotel, the front desk was extremely nice. There wasn't a long line and it was relatively painless. Because I had read previous reviews on the rooms, I opted to upgrade to a nicer room for only $10 per night which was said to be remodeled. When I entered the room, I was like, there is no way this is a 4star hotel and thank goodness I upgraded. However, the room was very noisy, every thirty seconds I thought I was hearing the roller coaster. Imagine hearing the coaster at Space Mountain pulling in, that is the exact sound. So I called down to the front desk and asked them what time the roller coaster stops running and they told me at 11pm. So I was fine with it because I wasn't planning on being in the room during the day, just wanted to make sure I would be able to sleep. However, while I was on the phone, my bags arrived from the bellman and he informed me that was not the roller coaster I was hearing, it was the elevator shaft. So I asked to be moved. They were very accomodating. The room I am not in (at this very moment as I write this). The room is quieter, but you can still hear the elevator shaft. In speaking with people that work at the hotel, they tell me they wouldn't stay in one of the rooms either and "what were they thinking when they designed the hotel and the rooms". As for the aestetecs (sp?), they did attempt to remodel or better stated, update the rooms. For a four star hotel on the Las Vegas strip - they missed the boat. With all the new hotels going up, getting completely revamped, I am afraid the NY NY rooms look and feel about as old as the Statue of Liberty. Popcorn ceilings, parquet paneled armoire (really, who would have thought?) and hideous bedspreads that look very worn.Sorry for the long write-up on the room, just want to let you know what to expect if you do stay here. If you can live with the forementioned, you will be in good shape.The staff is very very friendly throughout the hotel, casino and restaurants. Absolutely would recommend gambling hear if you want to play craps or blackjack. The table limits in the morning are $5 and by 11am move to $10, depending on how busy they are. Compared to many of the other 4 star hotels, this is great if you want to play low limits. The other hotel minimums I experienced were $15 and not as friendly. Huge shout out to Calvin at the Craps table, he never missed a bet and chatted everyone up.The nightclub is ok, no line. I think this is more an indication of the economy and the location. The club at the Encore is the hot spot in Vegas at this time. And the NY NY hotel is at the end of the strip, down by Excalibur, which is not an ideal location for me.And, I can't forget, LOVE LOVE LOVE the Dueling Piano Bar. Went there all three nights and always had fun! Always met fun people and really enjoyed the variety of music.BTW- I'm not a huge roller coaster fan, but got talked into going on it. It is SOOOOO much fun. However, everyone in lined agreed that it wasn't worth the $14 per person. Which if you are traveling with a family, can add up quickly.In summary, recommend coming down to NyNy for a little gambling and the Dueling Piano bars. But, with so many GREAT deals on the strip, stay at another hotel if you want a peaceful night sleep.
Great place to stay.	Nice location on the strip, many nearby attractions. Hotel was clean, nicely decorated, and had many things to do.

Great location okay price no in-room coffee maker	We stayed at NYNY, Las Vegas on Halloween and 3 nights following. We were very excited to be on the 25th floor and the view did not diappoint. I called to request one and was told they were not available. (of course I could have purchased a pot of coffee through room service for $9 plus a $3 service fee). Pool and hot tub area was clean as was the entire casino. Lots of amenities on site and the italian restaurant in the hotel was excellent!!

Nov 21 2009 	An OK hotel at a good price	We stayed at NY, NY as part of a package deal with Allegiant Air. For the price we paid, it was a satisfactory place to stay. Check-in was quick and friendly at 2 pm on a Sunday. Our first room was on the 7th floor and the rollercoaster plus other strange noises kept us awake. The next day we were moved to a room on the 26th floor with a great view of the mountains at no extra charge. It was very quiet and fairly spacious. Things I didn't like about this hotel included the extremely noisy lobby and the fact that there was no coffee maker in the room. Also, we were charged $3.00 per day for the telephone, even though we never used it. The restaurants were ok, but pricey. Fish and chops at the Irish pub was exorbitantly priced at $20-later found we could have had about the same meal from one of the small village restaurants for much less. We ate one breakfast and one dinner at the Italian restaurant and one dinner at the Mexican place and enjoyed them all. The location was a little farther south than I would have liked. If we return to Vegas, we would probably choose a slightly quieter place more towards the middle of the strip.

Nov 19 2009 	Average we stayed there to take advantage of the 2 for $99 Zumanity coupon.	First-time visit to Vegas, so we didn't know what to expect other than the photo on the hotel site. We were in a 28th floor Park Avenue room that had lovely distant views of the mountains near the city. Being so high up gave us a grandiose view of the western part of Vegas and the roller coaster far below us. It also kept the city noises down.Check in was quick and friendly and the room was clean and roomy. Location on the strip is convenient.My beefs:No free wi-fi internet. Unacceptable.No coffee machine in the room. Unacceptable.Noise: poor sound insulation between the room and hallway. That really surprised me.Gambling: Way too smoky, if you're a non-smoker prepare to be inconvenienced by the smoke in the casino area in the mid-afternoons into the late night. Gross. *cough, cough*. Hey, saved me some bucks!Would I stay there again? Probably not...we went there to save money on the Zumanity show (good fun, btw) with a 2 for $99 special. Next time, we'd go elsewhere.

Nov 17 2009 	Would rather have been in New York City!!	yes it had all the glitz and somewhat glamour, but overall would rather have been on a sunny beach in the FRESH air!! Nov 17 2009 	annoying hotel which charges you for everything	I've stayed in Vegas a few times and stayed at the NYNY hotel before. I picked this hotel because it was the cheaper than many others and is conveniently located. The hotel is just the same as the big hotels on the strip. While it is okay it has some really annoying things which infuriated me. In fact, I was totally fed up with it to be honest. First, while there is free parking, to get to your room is an arduous task with suitcases. You park in the self park area; then you lug your cases out of your car; then you get the elevator to the walkway; then you walk the walkway; then you get the esculator; then you fight through the floor of slot machines and poker tables; then you get in line for check in; then you lug your cases back through the casino and get one of the elevators up to the floors of your room (anything from 20+; then you walk corridor after corridor to get to your room. Then you find there are no coffee making facilities; I am addicted to coffee; I find it outrageous that you can check into a Best Western motel and have microwaves; coffee machines; fridges etc and pay a reasonable rate yet in this much more expensive hotel you don't get a coffee maker forcing you to have to leave your room, back down the elevator; through the casino to one of the coffee shops for which a medium coffee can cost about $5 - ridiculous. i noticed that at Wallgreens across the strip they were selling coffee makers for $18 - if I would have found that the first day I would have just bought a coffee maker. Then, no free wi-fi. Instead you have to pay $15 for 24hours. Again, in comparison with Best Western this stinks. Hey, the hotel has a roller coaster which is great. But, $14 for one ride is simply outrageous. It's ridiculous. What makes it worse is that as a guest at the hotel you don't get any sort of discount for it. I hate the money grabbing 'trap' that you fall into when on the strip.I won't stay here again or, if I do, I'll make sure I get the best value by insisting on better facilities (and I'll get them).

Nov 16 2009 	New York New York	The hotel is beautiful. We really enjoyed everything from the roller coaster to the dining...Gallagher's Steakhouse was incredible!! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Nov 13 2009 	New years day stay	Awesome hotel. Affordable. Really cool layut of shops, restaurants and casino

We came in for an overnight stay before continuing on to the next location on our trip.Pulled up into main entry and a bell person met us straight away and managed to pile all our bags on his cart. Nov 12 2009 	great hotel- nice experience	the new york,new york is very nice - the registration woman was very pleasant - there was no wait ( we arrived on a Tuesday at 2p)--we had reserved a basic room and when we arrived we upgraded for $10/night extra - we had a view of the main street/the room was nice /very clean - big bathroom- we were very pleased with it --will definitely stay here again-----we ate at the Irish Pub downstairs one nite - food was very good-----and if you get a chance to see the Jersey Boys ,it is a great show

Nov 12 2009 	Fantastic hotel for the younger crowd	Stayed here for a week at the end of June (24th-01st July) with my girlfriend. it was my 4th trip to vegas and her first so wanted to make sure she had a hotel that would be a great base and with alright location.The room was thouroughly cleaned daily, and was a good size. we stayed in a park avenue deluxe room and had a view of MGM grand, the rollercoaster, and Tropicana. We were on the 17th floor and rarely struggled to get an elevator/lift quickly. Another nice thing about the room was the Bose Ipod dock. would have liked a flat screen TV but not really fussed since we spent very little time in there. It's true the decor could be better but its hardly outdated/run down. Bed was comfy and never noticed noise coming from any of the rooms near us (contrary to peoples comments about thing walls). Shower pressure was great. Other thing to note on the room was that we never heard the lift or rollercoaster - probably because we were on such a high floor and at the opposite end of the hotel to the lifts so not really in a position to comment on peoples complaints about them.Check in was very fast (wednesday afternoon at 2pm) and the woman was very helpful and friendly. The staff in general in the hotel were excellent and more than willing to help you out if you need anythingthe casino was great and a nice way to finish the night off after a night out. the slots were fairly generous (i won $150 of a $1 bet!). the cocktail waitresses come round very often ifyou tip them a dollar a drink and even faster if you tip more (generally i tipped $5 for two drinks). me and my partner are by no means high rollers but we did get a $75 room service bill comped from the players club even though we didnt really gamble much money. You can spend hours in the casino on $20 drinking as much as you like. the trick for us was to stick to the low end slots and bet minumum. we never expected to win anything so to walk away with more than you put in was always an unexpected (and very welcome) bonus.mixed feelings about the poor. on the good side it has an atmosphere, good bar, nice jacuzzi, and lots of sun loungers. on the down side, it doesnt get any sun till about 11 and by which time it gets very busy. also the music they play is a bit repetitve. overall i liked it because i was able to plug in the Ipod, sip on a cocktail, close my eyes, and recover from the constant hangovers in peace.Food at the hotel is a mixed bag too. the steak house (gallaghers) is truly excellent and good value. never ate at ESPN as its not my kinda place. the village eateries are great too - especially the Deli and the 50's style diner burger place (near the rollercoaster) and they are a cheap and easy quick fill if you dont want to bother with a restaurant. I must be the only person who thought the pizza place was overrated since it always had a huge queue. also, avoid the buffet place in the morning as it just reminded me of left over chinese food.Nightlife at the hotel is among the best in Vegas. Cayotes is great, and Nine Fine Irishmen is my favourate bar in Vegas.The live band they have there are very entertaining (listen out for them playing 'seven drunken nights', or find the clips on youtube). didnt bother with the bar at times square so cant offer an opinion on that, and the same applies for Rok nightclub. the 24 hour bar overlooking the casino has a great view but watch out for the drinks prices!Overall, i love this hotel. it always has an atmosphere and its perfect for younger couples, lads, and girls holidays. if you want a quiet place in vegas, stay elsewhere as this place is full of life. the location isnt great but its opposite MGM grand which has a monorail stop for easy access to the rest of the strip.

Nov 10 2009 	Themed Hotel right in the action in Las Vegas	I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the years and it is a great base for exploring the Las Vegas strip. Nov 7 2009 	Amazing value on the Strip	Some friends recommended NY NY as being a good hotel on the Strip, and this certainly rang true for us. On researching for a hotel to stay at in Vegas we wanted something comfortable in a good location so we could see as much of Vegas as possible in the short 2 night stopover we had. We booked on their own website and discovered that their "Couples Package" was the same price as their cheapest room (Skyline I think), but included a free upgrade to a Strip View room, 2 free drinks, 2 for 1 breakfasts at one of the cafes, 2 for 1 rollercoaster voucher (which is a pretty good rollercoaster that goes around the hotel and costs $14 per person normally), $25 retail credit to use and a 2 for 1 Spa voucher (that we didn't get time to use). It also promoted a cheap price on a tour of Vegas sights but we didn't really see the need and it is definitely not essential to use to get this deal.Looking at the map the hotel may appear to be at one end and thus away from the most concentrated spots on the Strip, but we found it was definitely close enough to be in walking distance of most attractions.On check-in the guy was great - he was very polite and professional, went through each of the vouchers we had included and how we were to use them, and gave us detailed directions on how to get to our hotel room which was essential with 4 towers and slot machines everywhere blocking any signs they may have. A great first impression.Whilst it may not be the flashiest of hotels in Vegas the rooms are fine as are the casino, bars and dining. When you consider it was half the price of most other hotels around NY NY is definitely worth considering next time you go to Vegas.

Oct 8 2009 	Great view. Room was okay...	HOTEL ROOM: We stayed at the NY, NY hotel on the strip. We reserved a 2 night stay for $109/night. Check in was smooth with no problem except that our room was not ready. It was an early check-in so it wasn't their fault. However, they still offered us a free upgrade to a bigger room on the 34th floor with a view. The room had a long hallway before getting into the sleeping area which they justified as more square footage. Though the hallway was georgous, it had no function. The actual location of the sleeping area and sitting area was quite small. The TV was <26" and was located way across from the bed. So watching TV from bed was difficult. The bathroom was a good size with a walk-in shower, no tub. The showerhead was an older type and didn't spray out so well. There was what looked like a fridge under the sink area. It was actually just an ice maker. It didn't make any ice but made a loud humming sound every 10 minutes. The best thing about the room was the view. Their were 4 large windows facing West. There was a backdrop of a mountain range, the Orleans casino and what seems like a residential community. During the day it wasn't much but the sunset and night view was well worth it. FITNESS CENTER: The fitness area was one the other side of the property on the 3rd floor. It cost $25 to get in. The provided free bottled water, fruit and towels. The lounge area was clean and nicely decorated. Had about 6 treamills, 2 ellipticles and 2 stationary bikes. All with individual TV monitors. Also, had Olympic freeweights. Staff at the fitness center was friendly and helpful. FOOD AND BARS: Many of restaraunts at the hotel. Food was good. "The America Grill" charged your for every little item. Can you believe... $1.50 for a side of ranch? Otherwise food was good. The bar at the "Dueling Pianos" is a major rip off. Charged us $9 for a domestic draft beer in a plastic cup. Better place to drink is back at the "America Grill".BEST THING: Best thing I liked about NY, NY was the location on the strip. You are across MGM, Tropicana and Excaliber. All connected via a pedestrian bridge. WORST THING: The thing I hated about the hotel was the front desk reps. You always get a different answer from them. We were trying to stay an extra night. The night before, a rep said it would be the same rate as we paid for the previous nights ($109). Then when we came down to book the extra night, a differenct rep said it would be $149 and wouldn't budge. Then that night, we decided to take the $149 and they said it was gone. So we figured we were SOL. That morning another rep said, "Oh, no problem you can stay another night for $79." So frustrating. No one could get their stories straight. Bottom line... Don't try to modify your reservation. They'll just get confused.

Oct 4 2009 	Fun hotel amongst the Vegas glitz	This was my second trip to Las Vegas and I chose the New York New York for its mid price range and fun facade. I was very happy with my choice - the four nights I spent there were very comfortable and entertaining.I have seen a few reviews that complain about long check-in lines - since I arrived at 1:30AM I didn't have this trouble. I think the receptionist could tell I was very jet-lagged and ready to drop so he just quickly confirmed everything, showed me a map of the hotel (my hotel needs its own MAP?!) and pointed me in the direction of the correct elevator. My room was on the fifteenth floor of the New Yorker tower and had a view over the roller coaster to the Monte Carlo and some parking lots behind. With two queen beds and a whole lot of extra space it was very comfortable. The air conditioner was a bit noisy but I ended up turning it off - the room kept its cool quite well overnight if the air con was run during the day. I did hear a little "noise" from the room next door one morning but it was faint and I say good luck to them. ;-)The marble bathroom was really nice, with a good bath and shower. I was a little bemused though that despite all the signs asking for the conservation of water through reusing towels, the maid changed my towels every day no matter where I hung them. As someone from a dry climate I was really trying to be environmentally friendly but the maid service wasn't cooperating.Perhaps it was because I went in the late afternoon or perhaps it was because it was outside main holiday season, but I didn't think the pool was small and crowded like some other reviewers. I would have liked it to have a deep section (it is 3 feet for most of the pool and 4 in one small area) and perhaps to be a bit cooler given the hot outside temperatures but it was lovely to be able to kick back with a margarita in the pool or on a sun lounge in the late afternoon. I didn't go to Vegas to sit beside a hotel pool all day!Perhaps my one criticism would be of a hot dog place I tried late one evening - it had to be the most pathetic and revolting hot dog I have ever had, coupled with burned fries and a "root beer" that tasted like cough medicine. My bad for going down to the lobby half asleep and choosing the first hot dog stand I saw - I think the better one may have been near the bar! I also tried to get room service breakfast on my final morning but on my first two attempts got no answer at all and on the third attempt gave up after waiting on hold for 5 minutes.New York New York is a fun hotel to stay in. It's convenient to the rest of the Strip (although not central - if you don't want to walk, catch the bus or monorail), the casino section is reasonable but not so enormous you get lost and it has great facilities. You could stay there a week and eat at a different outlet/restaurant every night and still not cover them all I suspect.

Sep 29 2009 	One SLEEPLESS night because of a FIREBRAT	Out of a 4 night stay, we had ONE SLEEPLESS night. We arrived Tuesday evening, checked out Saturday afternoon. Check-in was uneventful and quick. Our room was on the 32nd floor of the Chrysler building overlooking the strip, the bridge and the roller coaster. GREAT VIEW and pretty quiet even though we could hear the roller coaster going until about 1am. Because we are from NY and accustomed to some noise, it did not affect our stay. It seemed clean enough. The hotel lobby provides several good places to eat: pizza- SIrrico's, sandwiches- Goldberg's Deli, italian - Il Fornaio. Gallagher's offers aged beef but very pricey - one aged steak, one order of mashed potatoes, one baby spinach salad, one new england clam chowder and three glasses of wine = $99.00 not including tip. I had lost my appetite Friday night and so didn't really eat, I only picked from my husband's meal. The hotel is one of the "four corners" shared with MGM, Luxor and Tropicana. The walkways connect the four hotels and allow you to cross the strip above traffic. The hotel lobby is kept pretty cold so I had to have a shawl with me when we hung out at the lobby. The hotel is not as big and overwhelming as MGM and you can get through it fairly quickly and easily. The pool is small when compared to the amount of rooms and guests staying. Finding a lounge chair is difficult and you can end up with a towel on the hard concrete surrounding the pool. Nevertheless, we really enjoyed our stay until Friday night when we were AWAKENED from a pre-dinner nap by a BUG in the bed! We caught the critter in one of the glasses they provide, called the front desk, they sent management up. We insisted that they find out what that thing was as we did NOT want to take anything back home with us. They offered to move us to another room, which did not make any sense to me since we didn't know that a) we weren't taking any with us to another room and b) that there weren't any in another room. So, we requested that they clean the room, vacuum and replace the linen. We were leaving the next morning anyway and were so tired and freaked out that we just wanted to know what that thing was. When their "eco" people came about 1:00 am, they informed us it was a "FIREBRAT," and not a bedbug. While we were relieved, we did not sleep well that last night. Our only compensation was that they allowed us to check out past 11:00am. Up to that point we were very impressed by the cleanliness of the room. We have stayed a various hotels ranging from the upscale at the Napili Kai in Maui to the low low Danvers Days Inn in Massachussetts and have NEVER come across a bug in the bed. Disappointed not only at the possibility that bugs are a possibility in even upscale hotels, but that NYNY didn't even offer to discount the sleepless night at all. SUGGESTION: ALWAYS check for critters BEFORE unpacking and settling into a room. Remove all bed linen and check the mattresses and bedframe before settling-in for your stay. This way if you find anything you can remedy the situation before they charge you and before you expose any of your clothing or belongings.

Sep 24 2009 	fabulous las vegas has something for everyone	Had a great time in vegas this was our second visit to vegas and 2nd stay at the new york new york hotel on the strip.
