The hotel is based on New york and has a relpica of the manhatten bridge,statue of liberty and several other references to new york. I love this hotel and would recomend it to everyone. Vegas itself is under a mammoth construction on the strip which will be amazing by the opening early 2010.Vegas has so much to offer and we loved it even although we are not really into gambling it's worth playing a few machines/tables as you never you may win and it's a bit of fun, besides when playing the machines etc the waitress brings your drinks which helps to keep the cost down as they only require tips.Weather in vegas was very hot and there is plenty of opportunity to lie back and enjoy the sun by the pool and some cafe/restaurants or to avoid the heat all the hotels, shops etc are all airconditioned which was a welcome relief.When in vegas i recomend the helicopter ride over the grand canyon which was just fabulous and breathtaking as well as fun, also you should check out the free light/fountain show that are on at many hotels as they are well worth a visit. If you ever wanted to try gospel, vegas is the place to do it you should try it out at the Gospel brunch in the house of blues in the mandalay bay hotel it is fantastic, great fun, a little pricey at $50 each for a buffet and drinks which was amazing with a huge selection of foods from waffle station, fruit and pastries to carved meet, and much more and mimosa( champagen & orange juice) and bloody mary's lined up on the bar, perfect for a sunday morning.Whilst in vegas do pick up the free guides as they are very useful with info on whats going on,maps and promotions ( we got a few vouchers and were able to use it at the goepel brunch) these are available in most hotels, monorails, taxi etc. After leaving the brunch we stumbled upon a bar(also manadalay bay) called minus 5 which was great, very cold but a fun experience were they kit you ready to go and party, where everything is made of ice including you rglass, tables etc, well wortha visit, $25 stay as long as you can and have a cocktail or beer of your entrance fee(only disappointment was couldnt take camera in as they dont allow but i guess it very cold, you have to but their own which is a bit of a con but well worth a visit). There is quite a cool collection of vintage,classic cars at the imperial palace that my husband really enjoyed ( good to get of the strip in the middle of the day).When purchasing any tickets for and shows etc chect out the cheap ticket booths on the strip where you get good deals on shows, exabitions,and restaurant deals, we got a voucher for $4 dollars each for Harrahs restaurant flavour which offered an extensive buffet choice at a really good price. Its worth checking out the prices at the hotel as we purchased tickets at the booths only to discover could have got cheaper at hotel ( although we still got a good deal would been betterif we had waited,the only thing is depending what the availablity is on the day. We checked out Love in the Mirage which was brilliant,worth a vist if yo want to be amazed with the acrobats,music and story.Although we had a really good time there were a few niggles: Tax on everything was a pain, and the guys on the street handing out cards for call girls, and the fact that we were id lots even though we are mid 30's and early 40's but other than that great. It is a bit pricey drinking on the strip but there are several bars and hotels do promotions and you will find it cheaper if you go off the strip a little.Head downtown to freemont st for the freemont experience which is a laser light show which is good and have a visit to the golden nugget and queens hotels as these are some of the original vegas, golden nugget has a really good asian resturant(ishis ?)and a very new modern bar and its cheaper, head downtown to a piano bar called Don't tell mama where they have a couple of singers who take requests and encourage the crowd to join in, bit more professional than a karaoke and the girls behind the bar are very warm and friendly and great singers.Looking forward to our next trip to vegas.

Sep 24 2009 	Good value for money at New York New York	We had a Park Avenue Deluxe room on the 27th floor which was spacious and cleaned daily. I wouldn't describe this hotel as a 5 star as stated on some web sites but it was comfortable and more than adequate if you don't spend much time in your room like us! There are plenty of places to eat and drink within the hotel, but we preferred to venture out to eat the majority of the time.Nothing is a short walk away in Vegas as everything is so huge but the location is excellent with all the best hotels on The Strip within a reasonable walking distance so I would recommend this hotel for location.The best thing about this hotel is the location and price, the worst is if you want to stay in a "grand" hotel this isn't as impressive as some of the others on The Strip - depends what you like to spend your money on!!

Sep 24 2009 	Ok but not amazing	We stayed at New York New York for 7 nights in Sept 2009. Check in - Possibly the slowest check in I've experienced ever! We arrived about lunch time to a check in queue of about 10 couples and it took 20 mins, simply as they only had 2 receptionists on! Customer service not particularly good, they were definitely just going through the motions. We were asked if we wanted a room with a view for $15 a night more, which we declined as we had not come to vegas to look out the window! When we got to the room we had the best view ever, which made us think we were going to get that room anyway - sneaky!Room - We stayed in room 2480 in the Century Tower on the 24th floor, with a view straight onto the strip facing MGM Grand across the road - amazing view! Bed was very comfortable and very big. Room was a decent size, clean, with a decent bathroom too. The only issue we had with the room is that it has an inter-connecting door with the room next door. This means you can hear everything from the room next door through the door frame! Our first night involved hearing a screaming match between two women for 30 mins at 2.30am! Called security who promptly came up and told them to keep it down. Luckily they left 2 days after and we got a quiet couple next door!Location - New York New York is south strip and a little out of all the action. We constantly used The Deuce buses (stops across the road and outside Monte Carlo next door). Everything looks close, but believe me it isn't! It's just everything is so big! Plus it was 100 degrees constantly, so not good for lots of walking. When I go back to Vegas I will be staying mid strip around Bellagio/ Paris.Pool - It is tiny in relation to the size of the hotel and it was dirty! Loads of bits floating in it, including birds feathers! I didn't even see a single bird in Vegas! Needless to say we only used it once!Restaurants - There is lots of places to eat at New York New York but no buffet restaurant. We ate in America and El Fornaio - both meals fine, but again not fantastic. However the bakery does amazing chocolate croissants!There is plenty of bars at this hotel and places for snacks - there is a frozen daquiri bar that do fab daquiris!Tip - The check out queue was always very long, so I would reccomend express check out through your TV!Vegas was absolutley fantastic, but New York New York was just... ok! Nothing special - I would only go back there if I got a really cheap deal there.

Sep 22 2009 	Comfortable and Fun	Clean, no problems with maid service, comfortable pillows and mattress, updated furnishings. We were on the 29th floor, good view, quiet. Room was given to us at checkin 1pm thursday no wait. Restaurants at hotel with comfort food, pizza, hot dogs, coffee, no frills, just average. Average Gambling, payout below average.Easy access to MGM Grand, Excalibur, Tropicana. Try MGM Grand Buffet, wide variety of food. Excalibur Buffet NO. Try Deuce all day pass to all other mid strip casinos.Don't miss Freemont Street Experience. Take Monorail to Sahara then take a bus or a cab to Freemont Street, it won't dissapoint, alot of fun for all. Prime Rib 9.99 buy one get one free at Four Queens Casino, plenty of cocktails. Don't Miss this place.Do not go to Coyote Ugly at NYNY if you are over 23 years old or sober. It is a sardine packed room. There is luxourious pools, hotel rooms and casinos in Vegas. Great Restaurants and celebrated chefs in Vegas. If this is what your looking for, this is not the hotel/casino for you ...do not stay here. Fun and young at heart, go for it, you won't be disappointed.

Sep 21 2009 	Not all its made out to be.	We made our way to this hotel having book approx 9 months earlier, on arrivals we were given our room which was based on the 25th floor a good way from the escalators, on first looks the room was clean and tidy, like most people you fancy a cup of coffee/ tea either late at night or like us early morning but I am afraid this was not possible as there was no coffee maker/ kettle in the room.This is only a minor point but the other is not so, this is that the Noise which was coming from not only the roller coaster which runs around the outside of the hotel, this did at least stop running around 22:00 hrs, but the other rumblings which seems to occur every 6 to 7 minutes this was put down to the monorail which operates from the Excalibur hotel across the road, somehow this monorail manages to transmit its noise across the road and up to the 25 floor of this hotel and i must admit it did cause me to have at least 2 nights poor sleep, (not going to bed until the early hours of the morning did help a little on the other nights) Otherwise the hotel was average the staff were all friendly and helpful. Another small gripe you did not get free wireless internet it cost 14dollars per 24 hours even at some of the cheaper hotels in which we stopped during our trip wireless internet was free.

Sep 21 2009 	Book another Hotel not the New York New York. Sep 20 2009 	Great trip but a few issues	Stayed for four nights in a Park Avenue Deluxe room on the 19th floor of the Century Tower. Sep 19 2009 	Great Stay	Check in was ok, upgraded room. Room was very clean and quiet and had strip view. Casino was slow but friendly. Lots of options for food but no buffet. Food was good and reasonably priced. Good location. Would return in future.

Sep 17 2009 	I absolutely Loved this place! couldn't have chosen better!	Being the Vegas virgins that we were I found the choice of hotels very daunting when i booked this trip. My husband is a theme park fanatic and said he'd only take me to Vegas if I booked a hotel with decent attractions! I origionally booked the Strat but was put off when they didn't reply to any of my e-mails and when I got a letter from my tour company saying that some of the facilities were closed at the strat and the area is a bit run-down. I chose NYNY as my friends were in Vegas at the same time on their honeymoon in the MGM Grand and I wanted something that was sligtly more up-market than the Strat but not as prices as the MGM. The upgrade I was charged was the best 100 - odd, that I've ever spent! We spent the week going in and out of most of the hotels on the strip and I actually felt a bit smug as we kept saying that we preferred nearly every aspect of our hotel than the others and we were glad we didn't splash the cash on the MGM as it was very, very, crowded and far too big for us although lovely just to visit for a few hours. (Having said that, had a great night in the West Wing Bar there) We had a Park Avenue Deluxe Room and even though it was a smoking room it was still big, comfortable and well equipt. Didn't expect I-pod dock! & we had a great side strip View of the Monte Carlo and even with the Rollercoaster going past all the time, we couln't hear it at all.All the hotel facilities were great and good value too. We hired a cabana on one day and found it to be great value for money. We were also given a list of promotions on at the NYNY & Monte Carlo that helped a lot money-wise with Discount on the Restaurants and bars and also show tickets & Rides etc.There are some great places to eat and drink at NYNY too which was part of the attraction for us. and we ate at the America restaurant on a few ocassions as the food was excellent quality and value in great surroundings ($17.95 for a 2 course steak dinner and a beer in a strip hotel is a bargain!)I also can't fault the service in any of the establishments, the staff in America, The front desk and by the pool were efficient, smart, knowledgeable and attentive, there was one exception to that on the casino floor, but he was just my bad luck charm and a cue to stop gambling away my holiday spends!I loved Vegas, and i will be back when I can afford it and would reccomend NYNY to anyone, we are glad we splashed out but decided that when we go again and the budget might not stretch that far, we liked the south side of the strip and would also consider Excalibur and Tropicana as cheaper options.

Sep 15 2009 	Hotel good would probably stay elsewhere next time	My partner and I were in Las Vegas to get married. Sep 15 2009 	Viva Las Vegas!	Nice hotel but I think probably like most of the Hotels in Vegas noisy and busy all the time. Sep 14 2009 	it did the job for our stay. but not luxury	very pleasant check in staff. although we enquired about upgrading our room were told there was no rooms available even though we were going to be paying for an upgrade. we had an 8th floor room in the new yorker tower with an "excellent" view of a roof and the end of the rollercoaster. Dined in Gallaghers and the Italian restaurant both were really good. The pool area was really busy and very cramped with NO space between loungers. Most of the pool area is shaded until at least 12 noon. But once the sun hits there is no sun brolleys for shade. Good waitress service for food and drink at the pool. Another good thing is that if the pool loungers are unattended for more than 30mins the lifeguards remove the towels and allow others to use,So it stops people "reserving beds early in the morning and not showing up till lunchtime" All in all this hotel is ok for a few nights stay but if you are expecting 5 star luxury go somewhere else. Oh also the spa is great for a bit of pampering I recommend the hot stone massage and pedicure. Sep 13 2009 	Good Location 	This was my first time staying at the NY NY but have visted this casino on several occasions. Typically we stay at the Golden Nugget b/c we enjoy the atmosphere there much better. But, the NY NY was running a Summer Special that we could not pass up. SUMMER BREAK ESCAPE : $65 per night Tues-Thurs - 35% off Zumanity tickets at NYNY- 2-for-1 Drinks at BRAND Steakhouse at Monte Carlo- 2-for-1 Roller Coaster passes at NYNY- 2-for-1 Buffet at Monte Carlo- 2-for-1 ROK Vegas Nightclub Admission at NYNY- 2-for-1 II Fornaio Breakfast at NYNY- 2-for-1 Lance Burton tickets at Monte Carlo- 2-for-1 Spa admission at Monte CarloService: The hotel service was okay. The staff was friendly but not overly friendly. I was offered an upgrade to a suite for an extra $90/night. Ummm, no thanks! Room: The room was a decent size. We were located in the New Yorker Tower and had some strange noise throughout the entire stay. At first I thought it was the roller coaster but when the noice belted out I ran to the window to see if the coaster was rolling by but no such luck. It wasn't too annoying but did wake me up several times throughout the night. Places to Eat: There are several choices for food at this hotel. We ate at Chin Chin ($12-15pp) which was good, fresh Chinese cuisine. We also grabbed a couple of slices of pizza at Sirraros ($4 slice $15 whole pie). Gonzalez y Gonzalez was pretty good and quite resonably priced ($10-$15pp). There are several other places to eat such as ESPN Zone, and tons of places to snack... Ben n Jerry's, Starbucks... Location: The location of the hotel is great for strolling the south end of the Las Vegas Strip. Some of the close hotels are the Luxor, MGM, Monte Carlo (We ate their buffett as part of the 2-1 deal and it was GREAT. Loved the made to order Philly Cheesesteak sandwich.) Overall we had a positive experience. But given the choice, we will stay downtown at the Golden Nuggett. If you want to experience the Strip, this would be a good choice given the right deal.

Sep 11 2009 	I enjoyed this place	We had stayed from Aug.29 to Sept.4.09. We booked the Summer Escape package that got us a Park Avenue Room with a few extras (2 for 1 on many coupons). Upon arrival, we were greeted by a warm front desk attendant Jessica. She had upgraded us to the Broadway Room on the 17th floor in the New Yorker Tower. There are many towers to the hotel, as it's designed like NY Skyscrapers. Broadway Room: The room was very spacious and had a great view of MGM, and the hotels around it (Hooters, Excalibur, Luxor, Tropican, Mandalay) and the roller coaster. Bed was firm and the sheets were alright. I think I found a cigarette burn, but I didn't pay too much attention to it (Noticed it on the last day). The bathroom was marbled floor and counter with a sliding shower door. An Armoire with coat hangers. My complaint was with the 25" tv approx 15-20 ft from the bed on an angle. Nothing major, since we didn't go to Vegas to spend time in our hotel room :). The room is about 450sq.ft about a bit bigger than the base room at MGM (Grand Tower).Food: We ate at the following places in NYNY Hotel.Il Fornaio (Breakfast) - Service was fairly fast. Had the Corned Beef Hash with poached eggs, while my gf had a veggie omelet. Both were excellent and very fresh. This was part of our deal and we got it at 2/1 deal.Sirrocos (Snack) - Typical pizza place, nothing special. Loaded pizza with toppings, wasn't as thin/crispy as I would like it to be. Ate here twice, was fairly satisfied.Greenbergs Deli - Rueben with Matzoh Ball Soup. Both meals were a great way to end my trip and left me mighty full for the day.America's - If you order the turkey burger here, please ensure it is fully cooked. I had to return mine once as it was still a bit red inside. However, the waitress was more than accommodating and offered us a bowl of Chicken Noodle Soup (very filling). If you are there and looking to eat on the cheap, take advantage of their cheap eats (AYCE Pancakes, 11.99 16oz Ribeye, 14.95 Ribeye/crab legs). I had the Ribeye and it was one of the better steaks I've had. The nachos as well are filling and loaded with your typical toppings.Casino: Always a machine available, casino seemed to be quite slow at times. A fair bit of tables ranging from $10 and up including a rapid roulette table that takes your credit card. Daily slot/blackjack tournaments if you are a players card member (Free to sign up). Drink service is fairly decent for a casino of that size (I've seen worse at MGM or Mandalay) and there's a cigarette lady walking around as well.Nightlife: Bar at Time's Square has dueling pianos which they take requests (for a tip) and will play your favourite songs. LOTS of fun and a group can have a great time. Did not check out the clubs as that's not my scene. Also if you are a beer lover, check out Pour 24. An amazing selection of beers from all over America. My favs are Alaskan Amber Ale and Black Butte. From what we were told, Zumanity is an "Erotic" show, so if this is not your type, look into Love or Ka or O. All of which you can get for a good deal at Tix At Half, located by Planet Hollywood.Overall I did enjoy my stay here at the hotel, more than I did at MGM. A lot less walking, more style and appeal to it for me.Pictures will be up soon, if you have any further questions, shoot me a line.

Sep 10 2009 	Very Nice Hotel. Great Price.	I enjoyed my stay at the New York, New York Hotel. My first night I was booked at the Imperial Palace and decided to transfer to the New York, New York. I stayed a total of 4 nights at the New York, New York hotel and would consider staying there again. I would certainly highly recommend it to friends and family. The room was large enough, great view of the strip on the 25th floor (I got a free upgrade), The price for the rooms were very reasonable for a nice quality hotel. The room was clean and everything was brand new. I slept well on the bed and it was quiet. At first, I was concerned with the roller coaster nearby, but it really did not bother me and it's close during the night. For someone who travels frequently on business and pleasure and very picky with hotels this hotel is an excellent place to stay. It's also closer to the airport if you have an earlier flight (the planes did not bother me in the room -- barely heard them). The casiono is nice and big and well maintained. The selection of restaurants are great (i would recommend Gallagher's if you like steak). Not much for shopping, but they have a few stores for souvineers. They also gave me a $100 coupon book and I got restaurant and food discounts, plus free welcome drinks.My only caveat is that it is all the way at the other end of the strip and if you do not like to walk it might be a bit inconvenient. Otherwise, it really is not a bad walk down the strip and besides its nicer to walk and see the sights. I would not recommend that you take the monorail across the street at the MGM Grand unless you're going to the northern part of the strip. It's better to walk to the other casinos and hotels/

Common areas (hallways and elevators): The up keep of the common areas was below average. Sep 8 2009 	Nice Place but ventilaiton needs improvement	First off, I should mention that the NYNY, Las Vegas is one of the nicer MGM Grand properties. The design and layout of the facility is much more convenient than the massive hotels like The Venetian where we stayed on our last trip. We arrived on Saturday evening of Labor Day weekend and upon check in were told that the non-smoking Park Avenue Deluxe room was unavailable, however they would upgrade us to a Broadway room - but would have to take smoking. This normally doesn't bug me too much, so agreed. However, the room really smelled bad, as did the whole casino. It was kind of a dank ashtray odor that permeated everything. Someone might say: "this is a casino, and you had a smoking room - what do you expect". My response would be that NYNY was a bit over the top. This is the first time I can remember being so affected by residual smoke, and ended up having sinus congestion, coughing, and other minor respiratory issues while trying to sleep. These issues would clear up as soon as I walked out of the building. The engineering department needs to work on the ventilation.I can't end this review without mentioning some of the nice positive things. The breakfast buffet at Chin-Chins was really good. The Chinese style eggs, fruits, meats, etc. were excellent. I also loved the foot long hotdogs, and authentic pastrami on rye at the Greenburgs Deli - just like it was made in New York City. I also should mention that the staff of the hotel were very helpful, courteous, and went out of their way to treat the customers with a personal touch.

Sep 7 2009 	New York New York Hotel and Casino	My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our first year anniversary from Aug 30- Sept 4. It was our first time in Las Vegas so we didn't know what to expect. As with all our trips, we checked trip advisor for reviews. There were more good than bad so we decided on the NYNY hotel. We had the time of our lives (so far). The hotels lobby was really nice! We were greeted by a many many slot machines!!! We arrived at 11am which is b4 check in (3pm) so they allowed us to check our bags in a holding area and the receptionist gave us a confirmation number and telephone number to call to see if our room was ready. Our room was ready by 1pm so we picked up our keys and baggage and went to our room.The Room: The Broadway Deluxe room was nice and spacious. We loved the fact that we had a great view of the MGM Grand, the roller coaster, the Excalibur, and more! The only thing that I hated was the TV. The TV was sooooo small.... I mean...ARE THEY SERIOUS!?!?!? The bed was at LEAST 10 feet away from the bed and they had this little (what seemed to be 19") TV that didnt ALMOST fill the space it was sitting in! My husband and I laughed soooo hard when we got in the bed and turned the TV on... We were gonna buy some binoculars just so that we can see the darn thing! The bathroom was huge and really nice! The water pressure, though, was really low. The bed was really comfortable and thats a plus! The roller coaster was directly outside our room, but it never bothered us one bit!!!The Pool:The pool and hot tub area was nice. The deepest part of the pool was only 4 feet so I didnt like that too much! But it wasn't too crowded. The Rollercoaster:My husband and I checked out the rollercoaster because everyone seemed as if it was soooo much fun! It was more of a headache ride for me personally. Sep 7 2009 	Mixed feelings	This hotel is really average, there is nothing to be highly enthousiastic about. I have stayed in the Stratosphere before and this is pretty much like it. The rooms are fine, but make sure you book a park avenue room and not a skyline room since the skyline rooms were last remodeled in the iron age. The hotel charged it back but i really didn't appreciate this 'measure against fraud' as the hotel calls it. People should stop complaining about the rollercoaster:it only runs from 10.00am till 00.00am and who goes to sleep before 00.00am in Las Vegas?! And you don't even here the coaster. But to be honest: it's better to spend a little more money and stay in a much better hotel like MGM/Bellagio or the Mirage. You will not regret this!

Sep 4 2009 	Great Place Great Time Good value! Aug 25 2009	Good Budget Fun Place to stay in Las Vegas	My niece & I stayed her for three nights about 2 weeks ago. The bathroom had a bath with shower attachment and solid sliding shower doors on the bath - pressure to the shower was very good and all the usual toiletries were provided as well as ample towels & face cloth. There was a vending macine and ice point on our floor and an ice bucket was provided in our room. Wi-fi and hard wired internet was available although you didi have t o pay for this. No complaints about the room at all - we were very comfortable during our stay although we did not spend too much time in it - just showering between various tourist visits and for sleeping. The rest of the hotel was a real WOW factor for us - being our first time in Las Vegas we were absolutely gobsmacked with the entrance, the casino and the decor throughout. We really felt as if we were part of the gambling capital of the world and it exceeded all our expectations. The choice of dining within was very good - posh or fast food - make your choice and the prices were very reasonable. The Italian restaurant IL FORNAIO was so good that we ate there for two evenings - the second time after we had been through the Excelsior and Luxor looking for something to eat but nothing appealed. The food and service was exceptional and although there was a queue on both nights to get in - this moved very fast.The pool area was well kept and big enough. The casino had a good variety of slots and other gambling available and was very lively.Our check-in went very smoothly and we did not have to wait long at all (it was a Monday that we checked-in) and the reception staff were always very helpful when we asked any questions.We used the ground transport service (SHOWTIME) which you will see as soon as you go out of the arrivals door onto the airport concourse - there are several ground transport companies there. We booked a return ticket with them as it was slightly cheaper to do so - you call them back when you check in to your hotel to arrange your return pick-up time; we had trouble getting through to them because they had a fault on their phones but eventually we did get through and the chap I spoke to was very curtious and booked our return with no problems at all. I beleive that if there are more than 2 of you travelling it is cheaper to get a taxi - we paid about USD 15 each for our return fare.I cannot think of anything negative to say about New York New York - the location is very good, rooms are clean and staff very friendly.

Aug 16 2009 	Best Vegas Hotel	My husband and I spent our 6th wedding anniversary at the New York New York Hotel and Casino and had a GREAT time. Aug 9 2009 	Perfect Location!	My boyfriend and I stayed at NYNY for 4 days and really enjoyed it. This hotel was literally 2 minutes outside of the airport which was a bonus!!! We were given a coupon book with many savings discounts that included 2 for 1 roller coaster ride, 2 welcome cocktail drinks etc.We had a really nice park avenue room on the 18th floor with the view of the parking lot which we didnt mind as we werent going to be in our room as much. The size of the room was pretty adequate. The king size bed was comfortable, room and washroom was super clean. Elevators was far from our room so we couldnt hear people coming and leaving from all hours of the night however there was a little bit of noise from the roller coaster tracks which was not an issue.The casino had a great atmosphere with high ceilings that allowed the smokey air to travel. It was bright and huge. The music keeps you grooving. The pool was refreshing for hot afternoons. It wasnt as big as I thought it would be. There were a lot of sun chairs to sit in and was never too crowded. You dont have to worry about bringing your own towels as they have some available for you.There was a variety of cafes and restaurants in the hotel. We tired the Italian and Spanish restaurants -both were amazing. We went to Excalibur one day for the all day all you can eat buffet for $25 dollars. It was okay. We tired the buffet in the Bellagio which we found to be a bit pricey. There were so many places to dine  make sure to try everything!!!!Transportation was not a problem at all. You can hop on a double decker bus that runs along the strip for $3.50 one away or $7 - 24 hr all day pass. The monorail is accessible behind the mgm grand and runs a 7 station route for $13 one day pass or $5 single ride. We saw cirque du soliels zumanity. It was very erotic and worth every penny. The shark reef in Mandalay bay was very interesting there were lots of exotic fish and sharks. The Paris Eiffel tower is a must see. The view from up there is very memorable. We didnt go to any clubs. Most places were charging $30 per person to enter not including drinks.Check out is at 11 am but you have the option of leaving your bags in the storage room if you have a later flight. There is no extra cost for this. Just make sure to tip the storage keeper. There is a standard fee of $3 per night for local calls. This will automatically go on your bill whether you use the phone of not. The weather in July was unbearable. It was stifling hot during the day, dry and humid at night. Pack a bottle of water everywhere you go. Bring lots of sunscreen and walking shoes. This hotel is on the south end of the strip. It is perfect as you can start from where you are and walk up towards the middle and back to other side of the strip. Perfect location!!! Overall it was a fabulous experience. I would definitely return. 4 days is not enough. Las Vegas is truly fun. Lots to see and lots to do.

Jul 31 2009 	A fun hotel and casino with great food options."	My wife and I stayed at NYNY and I really enjoyed it. Jul 28 2009 	Great theming good room over crowded public areas of hotel	Decided to stay at the New York New York due to the interesting architecture, ambiance of the casino, and theme of the hotel. Further it was a reasonable price for the room (mid-pricing level for the strip). We stayed for 7 nights so I our experience was a bit longer than most. So first the good:Whoever said the walk from the parking deck was long must have been 90 and carrying an oxygen bottle. It was EXACTLY 100 paces from the vestibule of the parking deck (entrance to ENCLOSED walkway is on 3rd floor of parking deck) to the actual hotel and another 30 paces to the escalator which drops you right next to the registration desk. Registration was quick (Friday afternoon, approx. 3PM PST) and effortless. They had all the right information, including the rate and gave us a room on the 20th floor of the Century Tower (closest tower to the registration desk, I might add). Room 2077 was a bit far from the elevators, but they'd asked us what we wanted and I chose to be farther away from the noise of the elevators. And it was QUIET! The room (Park Avenue room) was no better/bigger than you would get at a Courtyard, but we also didn't pay more than you would at a Courtyard. Room was clean, smoke free (requested), appointments were appropriate and comfortable, and maid service was EXCELLENT! Despite not getting enough shampoo towards the end of my stay, they were quick, polite, and very courteous. We called for a 2nd blanket the first day and it was delivered within 10 minutes. I'd say that the "hotel" part of the property is fabulous! As for two restaurants worth mentioning, Greenberg's deli was great for lunch and Scirraco's pizza was awesome (even for a Chicagoan who loves his deep dish!).Dueling Pianos at Times Square was fun! Rollicking good time! I'd suggest paying the extra $$ to get preferred seating if you plan on being there a long time. Now for the bad:The other restaurants are overrated and have very odd hours (can't get a donut at Stadium Snacks until after 11AM??!?!?). Hotdog stand not open late to get a quick dog, nachos, or pretzel. The breakfast buffet at Chin Chin's was very VERY disappointing! Very small selections, no omelet bar, pastries were VERY stale; not a deal at $16 per. Il Fornaio (shop, not restaurant) was okay for something quick (bagel, croissant) but not great. ESPN Zone was terrible. No other way to describe it (if I wanted a microwaved hamburger, I'd have done it myself!). Chin Chin's (dinner) was a glorified (and expensive) Panda Express, and the waiter could have cared less whether we were there or not. America is adequate for breakfast, but pass for all other meals (soup was COLD!).The pool is SMALL!!! I MEAN SMALL!!! DID I MENTION THE POOL IS VERY SMALL???Other than the hottub, no other amenities at the pool except for a volleyball net spanning the middle, making it difficult for anyone to do laps. It's also mostly shaded, not much sun hitting the pool area. Note that they post that no outside food/beverages will be allowed, however I brought (4) small bottles of water in with us and nobody gave me any grief.The casino has nice atmosphere (open, high ceilings so you don't feel claustrophobic) and unique design. Sports TV's over each table is nice touch. Cocktail waitresses come by often when playing at the tables (not so much at the machines). Dealers, however, were quite rude, not caring whether you were there or not. Not fun (Excalibur Blackjack dealer-Jimmy....HE was fun!!!). Didn't tip too often (despite playing Pai Gow for about 6 hours one night).Shopping stinks unless you want Harley gear or cheap Vegas souvineirsOne word sums up the NYNY, however: CROWDED! "Streets"/aisles are too narrow to get around without bumping into EVERYONE! By day 5, couldn't take it anymore. (Why would you put a post for the roller coaster right in the middle of two popular food stands and on the way to the main bathrooms?!!??) Way too many people crowding into that place. Need to figure out some crowd control/traffic control.Overall: Hotel good. Casino: Overcrowded Restaurants: Poor

Jul 28 2009 	Nice Hotel - thin walls	Having stayed here once before, we figured we would do it again. Second issue was that we were about a 5 minute walk from the elevator...but that happens in Vegas sometimes. My biggest issue is the THIN walls. Some people next to us were having some sort of party - from what they were saying it was possibly an orgy. We couldn't believe what we were hearing. Then it got quiet so we went back to sleep. At 3:00 am it started back up and then got quiet again. Third time - 5:00 am - I finally called the desk and they sent someone up. It's not the hotel's fault that this goes on but it seems that the walls shouldn't be so thin as to hear EVERY word someone is saying in another room. I thought we were getting a better room than the Park Ave. We never had that sort of experience in the Park Ave. room so IF we ever stay here again, we will not ask for the B'Way Deluxe. I would probably still recommend the hotel but only in certain areas of the hotel. Other than the room the casino is great - we love it there - and Sirocco's Pizza is fabulous. Jul 4 2009 	Amazing hotel but could be better	This was my third trip to Las Vegas and I wanted something a little different from the same old, same old hotel, mainly because I was taking a friend who had never been to Vegas before. Jul 2 2009 	I had a great time!	Arrived at NYNY in the evening. Check in was very straight forward, we were upgraded without asking and at no extra cost which was a nice surprise. Our room had a view of the MGM with the mountains in the background - lovely. The TV was very old, and the selection of channels limited however we weren't there to watch TV so this was a minor comment. The bathroom was clean, large, the shower was ideal (not the pathetic trickle I've experienced in some hotels), and there was plenty of shelf space to store our toiletries.The service at the hotel was great. We had difficulty operating the safe (those who had vacated the room before us had not left it unlocked). We called reception and within 10 minutes someone was up to fix it, including joking with us that we could split the contents (there was nothing in it though!). My bag was delayed and I received a voice message (as I was out of the room at the time of the call) to say that my bag had arrived. I called the baggage desk and again within 10 minutes my bag was delivered to the room. Room service was another pleasant experience (although the charges added were very high - as is the case with most places in fairness). Food was lovely, large portions, and was delivered within 40 minutes (we were advised of this when we ordered).One thing to note is that the hotel is the $21 phone charge that was applied ($3 per day for a 7 day stay). I used the phone three times (to check up on my bag), and obviously there would be a charge for that but it appears this charge applies regardless. $21 is not a big deal, however when you are in Vegas you may have gambled all your money away before checkout!The location of this hotel is not perfect, but its not awful either. There is a bit of walking involved if you want to go to the Mirgage/Ceasers etc (about 30 minutes, but the heat is impactful). There are plenty of air conditioned casinos along the way that you can pop into to cool down. Overall I think this hotel is great, although I would be tempted to stay further down the strip next time.For tourists please note: I looked online into buying tickets for a few shows and the prices were very high. There are numerous "Tickets for Less" booths along the strip that offer great deals. Of the two shows we attended we had great seats.

Jul 1 2009 	Turn back time	I usually don't write Trip Advisor reviews for chain or generally well-known hotels since I doubt I can contribute much that hasn't been said, but am reviewing the NY NY in order to note that it appears to have gone slightly downhill in the last few years. I stayed in the NY NY once in 2003 and it was great - exactly on par with the Paris - one of Vegas's really fun "theme" hotel/casinos. I stayed again in 2009 only to find best part of the casino area had been completely ripped out (the Central Park themed bridge and trees) and replaced with abstract gaudy neon swirls and a pit of slot machines. The New York theme was pretty much lost as a result (though once you venture out of the casino area into the restaurant section, the theme becomes evident again with the tenement style buildings, delis, pizzarias, etc.). The rooms are spotless but haven't been updated (e.g., projection TVs). However, the price did reflect this decline (at $79, the room was about $40 cheaper per night than the Paris).As an aside, it seems like Vegas, generally, is moving away from theme hotels/casinos like the NY NY, Paris, Venetian, etc. to just super-luxury (the Wynn, etc) and the action is moving further north on the Strip.The bottom line is the NY NY was a great value (very clean with good location and fair pricing), but it's a bit disappointing to see it starting to decline, even if the price has been adjusted accordingly. By all means, stay there for the value and gamble elsewhere in a more fun/luxurious environment.

Jun 29 2009 	No complaints good value	Our stay at NYNY was very pleasant. Drinks are expensive, but as to be expected (we brought waterbottles of our own mixes, but those ran out before we left). We didn't try the Monte Carlo pool, but overall the area at NYNY exceeded my expectations. We ate three times at the hotel - Americana for breakfast which had good food but was a bit too expensive for our taste (about $40 for two pancakes and two coffees), the Hot Dog shop which was quick and tasty, and the pizza joint, Sirrico's Pizza. We stayed at the NY-NY Hotel after receiving an internet offer for an upgraded room at a rate lower than the rates offered at our favorite hotels (Paris, Plazzo, and The Hard Rock). Check-in took about 30 minutes due to only one counter being open. There were approx. 20 people in line when we arrived at 2:00pm, but when the line increased to about 40 people they opened 6 more counters. The room on the 25th floor overlooking the pool was clean, the bed was very comfortable and had a partial view of the Las Vegas Strip. The room could only be described as average, however, being very small with a small bathroom. We could observe the roller coaster from our window, passing by every few minutes, but could not hear it so it was not a problem at night. We also didn't hear any noise from the adjoining rooms that previous reviewers had complained about. We did have a problem both nights with the DRUNKS in the hallways returning to their rooms around 3:00am yelling, laughing, singing, trying to open our door with their cardkeys, slamming doors, and anything else they could do to make sure everyone was awake.  Our major complaint about the hotel was the casino. This hotel, as well as several others seems to have removed the traditional types of slot machines (with bars, cherries, jackpots, etc.) and replaced them with newer video game types of machines. Even if we could figure out how to play these new video machines they require larger bets, so instead of losing 1-3 credits each time, you now can lose 15-375 credits each time. (The casinos switched over their slot machines a few years ago to accepting only currency and not accepting coins).  Our second complaint was the old style television in the room. Also the selection of channels was very limited. (We didn't go to Las Vegas to watch TV, but it would have been nice to have FOX News, and HBO/Showtime movie channels like the hotels provide).  All these changes in the casino caused us to do our gambling at other casinos, thereby causing the NY-NY to lose our business at their restaurants, souvenier shops, shows, etc. We highly recommend the Mon Ami Gabi restaurant at the Paris Hotel. The prices are very reasonable by Las Vegas standards, the food is great, and if you request a table outside on the patio (go after dark, because of the summer heat) you get a great view of the water fountain show across the street at the Bellagio Hotel). One major improvement at the NY-NY (as well as the Paris and the Rio) was that they seem to have gotten rid of the annoying "Time Share" sales people that endlessly harrassed the hotel guests and visitors. We keep hearing how the bad economy is hurting Las Vegas, but the crowds on the sidewalks at night are still there (even during mid-week). Maybe the visitors are staying outside enjoying the free sights, rathering than venturing inside the casinos to try and figure out the new confusing slot machines.

Jun 25 2009 	Great stay at the NYNY	We stayed at the NYNY for 4 days and had a great time. Check-in was efficient and the staff was very friendly. We had a Park Avenue room on the 26th floor of the New Yorker tower and it was very clean and quiet. The towels were a bit old, but they were clean. We didn't spend a lot of time gambling in the casino - the space was small compared to some of the others on the strip. The location on the strip is not optimal - you have to walk through a construction zone and past some small seedy strip malls to get to the action in the middle of the strip. We enjoyed the atmosphere of the Times square food court area. We ate at Fornaio and Gonzalez Y Gonzalez - both were good. The Chin Chin breakfast buffet was not bad, but could have had more choices (and the coffee was awful compared to the Fornaio). We checked out the pool one morning - unfortunately it doesn't get the sun until later in the day so we didn't stay there long. There was also a strange sewer smell sometimes (maybe it's near their garbage?), but we seemed to be the only people bothered by this so maybe it depends on which pool chairs you pick. We didn't check out the nightlife there as we tended to be out in the evenings, but the piano bar seemed to be very popular. All-in-all it was a nice hotel and we would probably stay there again.

Jun 22 2009 	Enjoyed NYNY but not entirely convinced to come back. Likes:*Lots of places to eat in the NY "streets"*Speed that the elevators came, as compared to Luxor*Flat screen tvs at the bar showing sports, also if you play the video poker at the bar, the bartenders are loose with the comped drinks*Easy access to all major casinos via monorail at MGM (it's not necessary to take a cab to say, Flamingo if you just take the Monorail)*Good drink service most of the time at the gaming tables and slots*Good players card rewards- one room was comped for 7 hours of table play!*Room quality was fine, it faced the roller coaster and it was fine, the noise wasn't bad at all*Room service was extraordinarily quick, came in 10 mins on Sunday AM*Easy access to airport since it is on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and TropicanaDislikes:*Bathtub was too high, made getting in and out for a shower difficult and no vent or fan in the bathroom*TV was 19" and closed captioning button was stuck so it was always on*Rips on both bed spreads (we had booked a king room and checked in at 3:30 and they were sold out so we got 2 Queens instead)*Make up mirror was falling off the wall in sink vanity area*Dealers were almost 100% unfriendly and not talkative with the exception of one or two who were immediately rotated out for breaks*Nine Fine Irishman pub had a nice atmosphere but charged $7.50 for less than a full pint*Pillows were terrible in the room- they were feather pillows and one was over stuffed and the other totally flat, and the bed sheet was too short for the bed, very strange.We would stay at NYNY again over Luxor but next trip we will stay center strip at another MGM property.

Jun 18 2009 	Penthouse Suite	Stayed here, with my wife, the first week of January. We had booked this, about 11 months in advance. We reserved one of the Penthouse Suites (NOT the Ziggurat Suites). We stayed on the 33rd floor. Our penthouse unit, was in the shape, of, an upside down "U". Upon entering the foyer, there is a guest bathroom, off to the right (simply a toilet, and sink). Continuing forward, there is a bar/kitchenette area, and, a sofa to the right. Making a left turn, there is the living room/dining room. Nothing spectacular. Proceeding through a door, and to the left, is the bedroom. In the bedroom, is a jacuzzi tub. Then, there is the master bathroom, which is actually divided into 2 rooms. The shower is amazing. The water pressure on that high a floor, is usually like turning on a kitchen faucet. This shower had NO trouble. Then, there are his/her sinks. Finally, in it's own little separate room, is the toilet and bidet.One of the bonuses to staying in a Penthouse Suite, is the VIP check-in & lounge. Seeing as it was our honeymoon, and, first time to Vegas, the concierges in that lounge were very helpful in getting us limos, tickets to all the Cirque shows, helicopter tours, etc. Plus, since our "VIP Host" made the reservations, we were always allowed on the "VIP" lines, at the other hotels.You can read about the casino in all the other reviews.I'd probably stay here again, but, I doubt I could get another Penthouse Suite (they seem to have withdrawn them, as an option on the reservation site).
