Airport/mountains could be seen behind this and you had fantastic sunrises every morning. Fair choice of eateries, a little pricey and felt a bit rushed in the American restaurant to pay bill - let me finish eating guys. Preferred buffet in Excaliber, purely because I can control the portions!!. Don't bother with MGM buffet(overpriced and more choice elsewhere). Fair location, plenty around to amuse. Use the Deuce bus for excellent value. Found casino very dark and smokey and was disappointed you couldn't use coins to play. Non smoking areas should be available but weren't. Couldn't get round the pool as were hogged by the invisible people brigade. This should be banned. Throw the towels in the pool!!! Went to see "Zumanity" no discount for guests. Show saucy and didn't personally think it was related to the "Cirque" family at all - wasn't that impressed and would prefer something else. Booked two trips with Casino tours. Both were well run and had a good day both to Hoover Dam/Lake Mead and to West Rim Canyon. Fell in love with the fountains at the Bellagio. If I came again I would have to stay there. Didn't appreciate being thrusted cards of semi-naked girls on every corner. If there is a mayor of Las Vegas - tidy up the sleeze and rubbish. Doesn't make for a pretty site. Overall New York is a fair starting point for a visit to Las Vegas. Remember: You get what you pay for.

May 20 2009 	Decent Place to Stay 	Visited 5-14-09 thru 5-18-09; girl's weekend to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday. I have been to Las Vegas 3 times in the past 8 years and this was the first time I stayed at the NY NY. A family member had recommeded it.I booked three rooms back in February for this weekend. I had signed up on their website to receive email specials and booked at a very good rate. Our rooms ranged from $65 on Thursday to $149 for Saturday. Of course you always pay more on the weekends. We checked in around 7:30pm; had to wait about 25minutes. Not sure why they didn't have more staff on hand but it wasn't too bad. The staff were quick and friendly. We had a Park Avenue room, a step up from their standard Skyline room. The room was non-smoking with 2 queen beds which were very comfortable. Plenty of room for two people. The bathroom was also large, all marble with a shower and tub. The vanity is in the bathroom. My only complaint about the bathroom is that the tub did not have a safety bar, the tub was a bit high and slippery. I would recommend if you travel with an elder, you ask for a tub mat.I agree with other reviews, all the rooms should have a coffee pot. I did request a room away from the elevator and roller coaster. We were on the back side of the building, two small windows overlooked the parking garage. It was quite a walk to and from the elevator but pretty quiet. I never heard the roller coaster at all. It is only supposed to run from 11am to 11pm.The rooms were clean and maid service prompt. No complaints there.In other reviews, I noticed people stating how big this hotel/casino is. As far as Vegas hotels go, this one is average. I think the casino floor is smaller than many others.The atmosphere is very cute. The shops & restaurants do resemble the streets of NY.Greenberg's Deli is a must if you like good ole fashion sandwiches. I prefer the hot corn beef on rye. For $8.00 you get a huge sandwich and they have a great potato salad.Plenty of food for two to split. The French bakery is to die for. Wonderful pasteries and sandwiches & soups. And of course, there is a Starbucks on the "street" corner.We ate the American a few times. $3.50 for a coffe was a bit much, but the food was very good as well as the service. Breakfasts run around $10.00. From the outside it looks small, but the restaurant opens up and is very large. A must see is the US map on the ceiling.Another must is the dualing piano bar. There is a cover charge and drinks are bit pricey also but alot of fun. If you call ahead and reserve a table, the cover charge is $25.00pp, but for special occasions it is woth it. Of course, be prepared; they will only honor your song request if it is attached to a $20 or better..! Several of the bars do have happy hour specials. Be sure to check those out at the NY Ny.We actually visited the Mandalay Bay hotel and went to the Rum Jungle for a happy hour. Their jungle juice was very tasty..!!The Monte Carlo Brew House Pub has a good happy hour also. You can choose from a list of $5 beverages and appetizers. We ordered all five appetizers and fed 5 people. Very good food and portions. I had 4 sky vodka cosmos and for $20.00..!! This bar has several big screen tvs to kick back and watch the games. A good place to visit.The pool is not one of top rated in Vegas. Be prepared, it is on the back side of the hotel and at this time of year, the sun hit the pool area around 11:00am. But to get a chair, you must be down there at 9:00 when they open. The Monte Carlo is an affilate with NY NY, and your room key will work in their pool also. The Monte Carlo is across the street and does have 3 pools, not real big ones, but a bigger area. Again, get there right when the pool opens for a chair.The NY NY is a good place to stay. I would recommend it. The staff was pleasant, the rooms clean and had alot of fun ammendities. I would stay here again only if the price was right. I agree with other reviews, it is at the south end of the strip.

May 20 2009 	What a Great Hotel	Stayed in the New York New York for six nights in the middle of May 2009.Managed to get an upgrade for the Hotel Room. 28th floor overlooking the Strip, which was a good size and kept very clean.The Art Deco look was excellent throughout.Casino are was one of the best out of all the ones seen mainly due to the very high ceilings allowing the Air Conditioning to work correctly not directly in your face.Pool was ok if not a little crowded causing a lack of sun loungers.All restaurants were good.Avoid ROK nightclub - Rip off on entry and very disappointing once inside.Bar at Times Square is a must with dueling Piano's great entertainment.Nine Fine Irishmen pub is good if not a little repetitive on the fiddly dee music. Careful on prices for drinks especialy Vodka and Red Bull.Coyote Ugly is ok but you will only need to visit the once.Manhatton Express Rollercoaster is a must.Overall would not hesitate to recommend and would re-book on a return to the mad world of Vegas.....

May 19 2009 	Average stay in a huge hotel	The hotel is located right on the famed Las Vegas strip and it takes just around 7-8 mins from the airport. Each way taxi would cost around $ 10 excluding tips. The hotel is located at the southern part of the strip and is just across MGM Grand hotel. The hotel is a huge structure in itself and the facade is a replica of New York Skyline right with the Statue of Liberty in front! Being right on the strip, transportation is not an issue at all. The Deuce Shuttle stop is just in front of the hotel and the monorail stop is just a short distance walk on the backside of MGM Grand hotel. The area around the hotel is quite safe and is teeming with people even late into the night. Centre of the strip hotels like Bellagio and Ballys are around .75 miles. The rooms are very average in size (I would say smaller than all the other hotels I have stayed in the US) and are functional in nature with all the basic amenities. However I was quite surprised to find that inspite of booking a deluxe room, there was no refrigerator/ mini bar or coffee machine in the room. The lobby of the hotel comprises of a huge casino with some 2400 slot machines besides a huge array of table game. A section of the lobby is designed to look like a typical NY street and has a large number of restaurants and food joints including a Starbucks outlet. One of the key attractions of the hotel is the roller coaster which goes all around the hotel. The Cirque du Soleil production "Zumanity" is one of the more popular shows in the strip though I was quite surprised to find that the hotel did not offer any special discounts/ schemes to in-house guests. Next time I would probably go for a hotel which is towards the centre of the strip. Overall its a magnificent hotel with all the associated glamour but wanting as far as warmth of stay is concerned.

May 19 2009 	NY NY I'll be back next year!!!	Hiya All,Stayed in NY NY Las Vegas April/May. My third trip to Vegas having stayed at Golden Nugget and TI before. I had a Park Avenue room and asked for a strip view for which I was happy to pay the extra $15 a day (but was never charged!). The room was fine.. clean and quiet and with a view of MGM and rollercoaster below. Room was a bit smaller than TI room I had last year. The best thing about NY NY is its a resort in its own right. There is so much to do and the atmosphere in the casino, bars and restaurants is great fun. I also found the gaming and slots to be better payouts than some of the others (won $500 on wheel of fortune slot). I just love Vegas and my stay at this hotel made me want to book again as soon as I got back. Any criticisms? not really the breakfast buffet was Ok on quality but lacking in choice (no bread or toast, just basic hot buffet and pastries) and the Breakfast at Il Fornaio was pricey ($24 for eggs, bacon coffee and juice) but not much else to gripe about. A great place to stay, it would be OK for singles, couples or families a special mention goes to Gallaghers Steak house  fantastic dry aged steaks, and also a mention for the Crazy Horse Paris show (Wow!...better than Zumanity) and KA both at MGM across the way, KA just blew me away Overall a great stay and a great hotel cant wait for next year!!

May 19 2009 	SO BAD DON'T STAY HERE CAN'T GET A FREE DRINK	So bad. Gambled for 6 hours on our first night and couldn't even get a drink - no service even if we wanted to pay! Noisy due to renovation and just seemed so unclassy. Disgusting atmosphere. Also no in a good location - long walk down to centre of strip. Switched to Paris Hotel which was THE BEST. was also ripped of by hairdresser who charge $100US for the worst blowwave I have ever had.

May 16 2009 	Didn't stay here-- thouroughly enjoyed the apmsosphere-- Breakfast buffet was delicious!	We walked over from the Flamingo looking for a different buffet to try. We stumbled across the breakfast buffet here at a Chinese themed restaurant (not sure of the name), it was $15 which seemed a bit pricey. I am not rating this buffet on it's size and variety, but how amazing everything tasted. The small amount of food options assisted me in not over-eating but, to really ENJOY eveything I put on my plate. Don't expect to get an omlette or have your eggs cooked how you like them.Do expect a variety of items you wouldn't ordinarally (no spell check--lol) eat for breakfast, such as fried rice with extra scrambled eggs-- a little odd, but delicious!! Our waiter was really cool too!

May 16 2009 	Ok Hotel	After researching for a few months I chose this hotel. NYNY is a neat place, I just wouldn't stay here again. It's not a bad hotel but I would rather stay a little further in the middle of the strip. We stayed Monday - Thursday and on Wednesday we hopped over to the Monte Carlo pool (which NYNY guest can be admitted to for free). The NYNY pool is small but it's fun. I would definitely suggest going to Monte Carlo pool, it's REALLY fun and it has a regular pool, wave pool and lazy river- it's a much younger crowd! We hit the piano bar-which is fun and we went to Coyote Ugly- it's ok but one night is enough. Also, the roller coaster is 2 for 1 from 11a-noon, if you tell ppl that you stayed here they always ask if you rode it- just go ahead and ride, it's only $14. Don't be discouraged if you have already booked here, it's a good place!

May 14 2009 	Rooms need updating...!	Good location. Easy access from all directions; very close to airport and freeways.Rooms need updating. A little dated. VERY small TV; no refrigerator or coffee maker in room. Plenty of drawer/closet space. In-room safe convenient and easy to use. (free)Lots of free parking...easy to access. Long walk from garage to registration area.Pool hours are terrible! Only open until 6:00pm!?!?!?Get a room away from the roller coaster otherwise you will hear screaming every night until midnite! (Expensive to ride: $14)
May 10 2009 	This place is awesome!	Stayed in the Broadway Suite...the room was spacious and had a great view of the strip!Didn't play any table games, but the slots were great!

May 8 2009 	Not as good as the Signature at MGM!	We stayed at the Signature at mgm in Aug 2007 cos we got married in Vegas but seemed to spend most of our time in The Newyork Newyork hotel because it had great slots, great atmosphere and good food so we decided to stay here this time and regretted it big time...luxury its not! and we went everywher except here this time??Basic it is and there was renovations going on that just seemed to ruin the atmosphere..the slots were rubbish too?Luckily I got lucky elsewhere and managed to win enough to pay for the hotel bill which was fantastic since I dont go on any machine over a $!Tried out the world famous rollercoaster which gave me a major migraine cos head got bashed about abit!!No coffee making facilities in room which was a real pain cos cant do anything till had that coffee!!Trying the Excalibur this year

May 8 2009 	Nice but showing some signs of age	Parking and check in were great. Usually I have a hard time getting multiple rooms taken care of, but not here. Front desk was very friendly, much better than what I usually get in Vegas. You will get nickel and dimed however - $3 for unlimited local calls? Don't people have mobile phones for this? But not too bad as far as additional charges go in Vegas. Also paid a whopping $30 for a roll away bed. Most of the rooms were upgraded a no charge because there were no more "standard" rooms. Views were terrible. Mine was of a strut on the roller coaster and the parking garage. Still had hair in the shower when I went into my room, also the art in the elevators were ripped off, and the wood veneer on my door was falling apart. Not too bad, good safe location.

May 2 2009 	A good value and reliable	If you're looking to stay in 5-star luxury, this isn't it. But I say NYNY is the Las Vegas equivalent of a Honda Accord. Not too stylish, nothing too fancy, but a few perks, some nice features, and very reliable and worth the value.I have only stayed here once compared to many other times at similar value-style resorts in Vegas, but I was impressed with the overall cleanliness of the property. The rooms are in good shape, have everything in order, and nothing in my room was breaking. The furniture is decent, offers a few clever features for storing clothes and making your life easy when coming in late at night, and the TV was a decent one.The bathroom is well kept, decent size for this type of property, and has everything you need. The housekeeping service was prompt and attentive; the front desk was packed as usual and not too helpful. The good news is that once you figure out the lobby, it's an easy hotel to navigate, unlike some of the monsters in town.NYNY may not have the best location, but if you're looking for relatively nice places without wasting money, you're still right across the pedestrian walk from MGM Grand, and next door to MGM Grand. Excalibur is the other direction for good value, so there are places to go to get out.The vibe at NYNY is changing, so it may not be your type of place now, but if you just want a place to sleep but don't want to be grossed out or surprised, this is a reliable hotel.

May 1 2009 	Good Location nothing special	We stayed in the New Yorker Tower, Park Avenue Room type on the 12 floor. Great view of sunset of the mountains; our room did not face the strip. Nice large window overlooking the pool at the back side of the hotel, but we didn't mind. After staying 4 nights, toileteries were only replenished one time. Don't expect personal items to be returned; we found some socks under the bed! There is only one set of elevators and our room was quite a walk from them. There are lots of places to eat near this hotel, such as Chin/Chin breakfast buffet, Fornaio, America, and Gonzalez gonzalez --we got sick eating here. This is just an average hotel, nothing to brag about.

Apr 28 2009 	Totally blah - wouldn't stay here again	We stayed here at the recommendation of my friend - we were arriving Vegas mid-evening, planned to have dinner and hang on the strip, then one friend flew out early the next a.m. and two of us wanted to hang by a pool before our evening flights.We had a Park Avenue deluxe room - which was large, but definitely felt old and used. I was really disappointed in complete lack of amenities for a deluxe room - no water bottles in the room to purchase, no fridge, nothing. The rooms were also VERY loud with hallway noise, and even though we were supposed to be a non-smoking floor, the entire casino had a pervasive smoke smell.Check-in was horribly slow. The pool area seemed an afterthought - crowded, loud music blaring all day, and a rollercoaster flying overhead. I guess it does have the noise and bustle of New York!

Apr 27 2009 	Enjoyed our time in New York New York!!	Hotel, like everything in Las Vegas is enormous. We had a deluxe Broadway room which was an excellent size and easily accommodated 5 of us. Not many hotels in Vegas would take 5 of us without making us book 2 rooms. Had a view of the rollercoaster but the noise was not a problem at all. We were barely in bed before it closed each night. Pool is lovely. Plenty of places to eat within the hotel and in all the hotels nearby. Location is good. It feels like the best end of the strip. A bus runs continually up and down the strip and you can get a 24hr pass. Definately worth doing if you are going right to the other end as it is quite a walk. Hotel is not far from the airport so for 5 of us it was better value taking a taxi than a shuttle. Overall we were pleased with this choice of hotel.

Apr 24 2009 	Bit Of A Let Down	We were very much looking forward to staying here as we had heard/read good things about it. When we turned up after an 8 hour drive from Reno we were a bit tired and probably our tolerance was running low but we had to wait about twenty minutes at reception despite seeing alot of staff behind the counter talking to each other, when we did get served the lady was very rude no smile or anything, anyway we got our keys and headed to our room which was difficult to find as there are many wings and different lifts.When we got to our room I was a bit repulsed to see a hairball(quite large) on the floor but too tired to worry about it, as our room was being serviced I thought we will just leave it there for the cleaners to vacuum up the next day-no still there when we got back from a day of activity. Finally I went downstairs to tell a man on reception who was quite nice but pretty blase about it. Now I know it's just a hairball and we could've just picked it up and put it in the bin but for the price you pay to stay here the cleaniness should be better. Anyway I feel this was an over-priced hotel and wouldn't stay here again.

Apr 22 2009 	Ok if you like poorly lit rooms dirty furniture and a small pool	Booked this hotel for business as it was comparable with others (Monte Carlo, Excalibur) in the same price range. Would have preferred Bellagio/Caesar's but they were all over $300 a night. This location was just ok. Rooms and hallways were dark, the furniture in my room was stained and dirty, and the bathrooms were outdated - when was the last time you stayed in a hotel/resort with a sliding shower door? On one visit to the pool found it to be uninviting and crowded. Basically, a slab of concrete filled with water. There were no open chairs, and no easy access to the pool as all the chairs surrounded the edges. Talk to anyone in the know, this is one of the worst pools in Vegas. I would not recommend this location to anyone, there are much better options on the strip.

Apr 21 2009 	Decent hotel nothing special.	Typical vegas, strip hotel. Nothing special, but it was nice. Great location, very few $5 tables (like most big hotels) so if you're cheap like me when you gamble you'll have to go somewhere else. Only ate at one restaurant, it was the breakfast buffet and it was pretty good and a reasonable price.

Apr 20 2009 	Nice Vacation	Stayed at the NY NY for 7 nights and had a blast. Check-in was a little slow due to computer problems, but the desk clerk was very professional and accomodated our room request. I tippped him a $20 for his profficiency. For the second time in 15 years we came home with more gambling money than we went with. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone staying on the strip in Vegas. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating.

Apr 18 2009 	Good Value Easy Location	Our family of 5 stayed here April 14-17 in 2 rooms 1 was a suite (for the me and the wife) and standard room (for the 3 boys). We booked a USAirways vaction at a great deal so basically we paid for the flight and these rooms were free.The location was very easy to get to from the airport and also easy to get around if you plan on driving around. The room had some water damage along the window and we had a lower floor room so no view. The Irish pub was great and they sat us in almost a private room on the 2nd floor. The dueling piano bar was fun also. We also ate at America was good.In the middle of our trip we took an overnight trip to the Grand Canyon, we stayed checked in to NY NY and just took overnight bags (We got our rooms for free so no sense in checking out)I would stay here again especially for the location and value.

Apr 18 2009 	Good value option on the strip	We stayed one night in Vegas as part of a 10 day trip in the US, and picked this hotel for value, location, and for being New York! We were not disappointed.We booked a Park Avenue Deluxe room with strip view as a upgrade from a skyline room for $15 extra, which seemed excellent value. Room was spacious and spotless, on the 30th floor with a nice view over the MGM Grand and airport.We also dined in the Hotel/Casino at Il Fornaio which was lovely and good value. Suspend belief for a while and you could think you were genuinely in a NY Italian restaurant! The 'Il Fornaio Panetteria' is a great option for a breakfast pastry also.

Apr 17 2009 	Nice. Great Value for the Money.	This is not the nicest place on the strip, but it is top 5. For the price, I highly recommend it. The rooms were clean, the people friendly. It is awfully crowded, though. Still, the Nine Fine Irishmen is the best place to grab a brew on the strip. I and my group had a couple of beers on the patio overlooking the strip (get there early and camp, or that space will be gone). Also, there is an In-N- Out Burger behind NY NY, which is great for curing hangovers.

Apr 17 2009 	New York New York gets it right!	We stayed here for 4 nights in April, comped for 2 nights twice with a four-day gap in between. Both visits were great. Friendly service, fun slots and good places to eat. We were booked into a nonsmoking King Park Avenue Room without a problem. Room was clean and featured a flat-screen TV albeit on the small side, extremely comfortable bed and marble bathroom. The room also was quite spacious compared to some others we have stayed at on the Strip. Both times we were next to the roller coaster, which seemed to run all night long (!) Once you got used to the rumbling noise, however, it was reasonably tolerable. That was a minor downside to a nice stay. As for restaurant choices, we tried Broadway Burger for lunch; not too impressed; by the time we got our food - a 20-minute wait for a "fast" food joint - the fries and burger were cold. The Philly cheesesteak sandwich was delicious and still hot. We also tried Jodi Maroni's, a sausage in a bun place, which was good but not as spicy as we would have liked. We ate at America one morning for breakfast - check out that MAP!! It is really cool!The food was pretty good, not great. The best place was Sirrico's pizza. We ordered pizza to be made, at $16.50 for a large - and took it up to the room to eat. It was one of the best pizzas we have had - ever! We wanted to eat at ESPN Zone as we have gone there before and it was really good food, and we had our own private screen to watch the hockey game. Unfortunately, we couldn't get in while we were there at prime time. The casino was fun and drinks were brought very quickly, even though it was very busy. Check out both times was a bit slow but efficient nonetheless. We were charged $3.00 per day for a "resort fee", which was really the use of the phone. You get charged even if you don't use it. We really enjoyed our stay at New York New York. It is also a walkway away from MGM Grand and a 2-minute walk to Monte Carlo, where you can save some dough and get McDonald's for breakfast! We saw Zumanity and it was okay (we were given 2 for 1 tickets with our room). We have seen Mystere and Ka and liked those much better.

Apr 16 2009 	reasonable strip hotel.....	First time in Vegas and stayed here - good price and room was spacious. Hotel looks dated and tired in sections - everything needs a update. (some rooms had been updated)Room had view over coaster which even though could be heard was not an issue as the screams made us laugh. Room was not up to our expectations and not cleanest we had stayed in. This did not bother us as only slept very little in there. The restaurants in the hotel were terrible - mexican was basic and the Il Forniao was far too expensive for the quality of food and service (the food was tasteless). Better off in the MGM or Mandalay Bay if you want decent food. (PF changs and the Outback are also good food and you can get view across down the strip.) Belagio buffet is the best! The bars were OK, Nine fine Irishmen had a freindly atmosphere and the Time square was great fun. Casino was great and unlike some hotels the waitress service was always around when you wanted a drink. We would probably not go back to the NYNY, as we would like to stay somewhere else, but there is nothing major wrong with the hotel, for the right price!

Apr 15 2009 	great place to stay on a budget	Great themed hotel and generally good for people who want a nice place for a decent price. We booked a skyline room and were upgraded to a better room (Park Avenue I believe). Standard room, very spacious. The only bad thing was that it was a smoking room when we are non-smokers. There are many restaurants at the hotel, something for everyone. Tip: the Excalibur is next door and has an all day, all you can eat buffet with in and out privileges for $25. The nightclub at NY, NY is Rok, if you look around during the day/night you can find someone handing out passes to skip the line or for reduced cover. The show is Zumanity. Be sure to get tickets early. Coyote Ugly is also at NY, NY. No cover before 10:30. Initially it seems pretty weak and almost embaressing, but if you stick around the show is entertaining (dancing like in the movie). There is a large arcade at the top level with a fun rollercoaster. $14 for one ride. The pool isn't huge, but it's cute and good enough for the trip.The casino itself is a fair size. As long as you're gambling (doesn't matter how much) they serve you free beverages. NY, NY is on the south side of the strip so a far walk to the Wynn, Fashion Show Mall, Venetian, etc - but definitely doable. The hotel is also attached to the MGM Hotel through and an over the street walkway .There is apparently a mandatory $3/night phone charge which gives you local calls free using the phone in your room. This was advertised in our travel voucher and posted at registration but we were never charged for this.

Apr 14 2009 	Good all around stay	We stayed ay NY NY in a Park Ave room. It was nice and clean, but pretty small. We had a view of the Excalibur and the roller coaster. Check in was a little slow, but overall the service was good. The pool area is small and nothing special. The food court area was nice, especially the pizza place. It was open late, so we usually grabbed a piece of pizza before heading to bed. The piano bar was fun and the whole casino had a good vibe. The casino is small enough to learn your way around which is good when it's 3 am and you can't think straight. The MGM across the street is huge on the other hand. Easy to get turned around in there, even when you are sober. Vallet service was good, and employees of the hotel were friendly and eager to help. It is located pretty far south on the strip, but there are several casinos and shopping areas close by. Overall we had a good stay and would recommend NY NY.

Apr 13 2009 	Average Hotel	My husband I and just returned from a long weekend in Vegas, we booked at New York because of the price through Southwest Vacations..We did upgrade to a Marquis suite and this room was large and clean, however it was old appearing..We have been to Vegas several times and usually the rooms are new looking or refurbished..this room like I said was clean, but the bedspread , the carpet, the bathroom let alot to be desired...We did enjoy the large jetted tub, felt good on the legs after walking all day...The rest of the hotel and casino were fine, not too smoking and we ate the pizza place, (good but way greasy) and we ate at the American restaurant because the were open 24 hours..the meals here were very good, ..The casino was small enough I learned my way around the first night.. All in all we had a great stay..Would I go back to New York--probably not..I like a more modern room...But the people who worked here were super nice...and this is a big plus.. Oh we also went to Anthony Cools at Paris, I don't think I have ever laughed so hard..I recommed this show.. The Serendipity restaurant was also very good with huge portions and too die for mojito's ...and I love the twisted sister drink at Diablo's yum yum..

Apr 12 2009 	Perfect stay - free upgrade	My wife & I went to Vegas because Southwest had 50% off flight specials and she had never been. I did a lot of research of trying to find the best place to stay for us. I have been to Vegas 3x before and have stayed at NY, NY once. I kept that in mind when I was looking, but open to other options. The bottom line though was through the NY, NY website they had a free room upgrade offer which would allow us to overlook the strip. I couldn't pass on this, for the price and the location of the hotel along the strip. The MGM Grand is across the street, as is a place to buy cheaper day off show tickets, which we took advantage off our final night there. We saw Beatles LOVE, Elton John & Blue Man Group in 3 days in Vegas. All tremendous shows. We did alot of walking, but the 3rd day there took advantage of the bus. The roller coaster at NY, NY was not running most of the time we were there due to the high winds. But, overall, we had a great stay at NY, NY and will stay there again.

Apr 11 2009 	good location enjoyable stay	We stayed at this hotel from 3/4-8/4/09. Check in didnt take too long - booked a broadway ave deluxe room - room was spacious (think this block had recently been refurbished) and clean, as was the bathroom, with a good, powerful shower. The view was the brick wall of the next tower - i called to reception about an upgrade to a room with a view but this would have been at least $15 per night so we decided not to as would be out on the strip for most of the stay - it just meant that the room was quite dark with no natural sunlight, so it was always nice to get outside! We stayed on the 6th floor, and only comment would be that you constantly hear the lift going up and down, even though we were not that close.Ordered room service one night, reasonable prices and you get lots for your money! The rollercoaster is worth doing, we also did the rides at the stratosphere which were brilliant, and you see some great views from the tower there.The hotel was in a good location, opposite the MGM and the facilities within the hotel were very good with lots to see and do. We went to see Zumanity, the Cirque de Soleil show based at our hotel (guests of NYNY get 2 for 1), and that was excellent. We also made use of the Deuce bus to get up and down the strip, but most of the big hotels are within walking distance (tip - take comfy shoes and a refreshing foot spray - i could have done with this after a long day walking up and down!).Would definately go back, although might also try another hotel just for some different scenery - the MGM, Mirage and the Venetian were my favourite.

Apr 10 2009 	Don't use their website to book room	Booked hotel after recommendation only to find out I could have booked same room thru discount site for $40 a night cheaper, it even linked me to new york's own reservations page. Rang the hotel to find out if the room I had booked (with a view) could be guaranteed (e-mail confirmation of booking pointed out that my room with a view might not be available, even though I had booked it four months in advance) as it was a birthday gift for my wife, only to be told that my room might not be available on the day I check in. I cancelled my room there and then, why pay the extra $40 for a room you might not even get . I e-mailed the hotel in the hope that I might get an answer as to why if I was willing to pay the extra $200 for my weeks stay could they not guarantee my room with a view. Guess what still waiting, so folks spend your money elsewhere because if they are that stupid as to give up $200 (lady on phone told me to book discounted room) God knows what the hotel service is like. My big tip is book thru discount websites as they all link you to hotels own reservation pages and there are some greats deals to be had.

Apr 9 2009 	Worth every penny we lost on the slots!	I booked this hotel because of what we saw on our past trips to Vegas. It just had a real nice ambiance and decor. The Bar at Times Square was a blast but of course there is a cost to that. It is Vegas after all. We ate breakfast at Il Fornaio on our last day and while it fine we preferred the breakfast at America more. We ate at ASPN Zone and watched the Canucks game which was a good time. The chicken ceasar wrap was great.We spent a lot of time on the slots and even won some on Deal or no Deal. The gentleman at the sports betting was quite helpful. Never tried the tables here.On arrival we had no line up. They put us in a room with two double beds. We had asked for a king. We called down and were told that they were full and to try again the next day. We had a strip view and could see the roller coaster. Yes we could hear it but it stops around midnite so who cares. When I go to Vegas I don't plan on getting to bed early. The next day we called around 5 pm and they happily moved us to a new room with an even better view. The move was as easy as packing our things and walking to the new room. No issues at all for it to happen. Was a little disappointed with the pool. It is not that big and can be hard to find chairs to lay down on. Not a big issue for us as we always have lots to do. Besides if I wanted a great pool area I would go to Mandalay Bay or Tropicana.The only truly negative thing I can say it the $3 per night phone charge. Frankly I do not need a phone so paying an extra fee for it is rather frustrating. I know others do it as well (Excalibur) but they were less. Some still include the phone. I guess it the way of the future but I still don't like it.All in all I enjoyed the NYNY. It was very nice and elegant. When you enter the casino area you go down an elevater which allows you to see the majority of the casino floor. It helps to look around quickly so you can see where things are and how to get to them.Make sure you hit Margaritaville in the Flamingo, Freemont St, and Coke World for different floavors from around the world. Beware of the flavor from......

Apr 9 2009 	Stay was nearly flawless	Stayed three nights on a busy weekend (Spring Break / CMA Awards / Final Four) in a Broadway Deluxe room. Second trip to Vegas (last time was Monte Carlo). The room was large and had two enormous banks of windows. Great views to the east/south - MGM Grand and Excalibur. Also, the coaster was right outside the window - some noise but never a problem. We loved the view day and night. The room was significantly larger than a friends Parkway Deluxe (which had 1 small window).We ate at America (L and B), Gallagher's (D), and Il Fornaio (B) inside the hotel. All were very good with great service. Avoid Coyote Ugly unless you like cattle conditions - crowded, no chairs, very loud music. The dueling piano bar is great - always packed. We did not try Rok Vegas, ESPN Zone, or the Irish Bar. The pool complex is good. Hot tubs are very good, but sporadic drink service. The gift shop/convenience store was great - reasonable prices on champaigne, etc. to take up to your room. The only small issue we had was checkin - lines were long (10 minute wait) and our room was not ready until about 3:30pm. The casino is good - above many. Hard to find $5 tables anytime on weekends - but I was told that completely depends on the crowds - you might on slow weekends.The spa is small but nice.The overall resort is very large, but they pack so much into every space that it gets very crowded - like all of the resoirts strip. After a while I was pretty tired of dodging people everywhere you try to walk. But, that is the nature of the Vegas beast unless you find a slow weekend or mid-week trip.

Apr 5 2009 	Clean Tidy and well located	Stayed here for 3 nights in July '08. Would recommend. It was clean tidy and very safe. The room was of a very high quality. Perhaps not the most expensive hotel on the strip but we weren't looking for that and we got more in the room then we were expecting. The staff were extremely helpful especially the front desk who provided us with anything we need.

Apr 4 2009 	NY NY Las Vegas is a good fit for us	My wife, son (age 17), and I stayed 3/31 to 4/03. This was our second stay at NY NY in 6 months. Don't be afraid to ask the desk for your needs. There is an attendant posted at the far right side of the registration desk who helped us with hotel information and even printed out map blast directions to a local business for us. My wife and I used our MGM players cards at the tables and slot machines. We have had good gaming luck at NY NY. The black jack tables have $10 minimums. We ate at the Asian buffet, the patio restaurant, and the fish and chips stand. All are good. Many reviews have mentioned the comfortable beds. Ours were fine as they were last visit. The nightlife is fun. Grab a drink and have a walk from bar front to bar front and enjoy the variety. There are a few nearby hotels which offer slightly better rates. We have stayed at these and found they are not worth it. We plan on returning this Summer on a midweek special.

Apr 3 2009 	Great but no wow	Just returned from our usa trip. New York New York Hotel Las Vegas, Great hotel.Check in was very quick, no lines. We had a Park Ave, deluxe room. The room was spacious and clean, as was the bathroom. Our view was of the Monte Carlo Hotel and the swimming pool. We could also see the roller coaster, but could not hear it, which was good. Only 2 negatives, of this hotel was that the walls are PAPER THIN we could hear everything. And I mean everything that the couple next door were up to....................................Our 2nd negative was that there was not enough people serving in the food areas which caused long lines, but apart from that everything else was good,

Apr 3 2009 	Average	Valet service was quick and professional, the check in was painless and went quickly. The hotel room was nice, nothing that blew me away. Apr 2 2009 	Great Room good fun had fun!	We were able to check in at about noon and we upgraded to a marquis suite which was well worth the extra $55 per night. Couple of huge positives about this room: 1. It had a hot tub that could fit three people in it if you wanted which was almost a must after long days of walking all over the strip. 2. It was on the 32nd floor with a great view and the top floors had their own elevator which skipped the first 20 to 25 floors which was awesome! The room was very clean and they did a nice job fixing the room everyday while we were out. There was a great Bose sound system with a DVD played that I wish we would would have known about because it would have been cool to watch a movie on that system. Apr 1 2009	Great stay for the money	I've played at NY NY many times but never stayed there so when I got a discounted room I figured I'd give it a shot. While overall I don't like the facility as much as MGM, it was certainly a good hotel.Check in was very quick and we were given our room upon check in at 11am. We asked for a room at the end of a corridor to keep noise to a minimum and this was accomodated. The room itself was decent, not over the top luxurious by any means, but quite comfortable and certainly very clean. It was also the quietest Vegas room I've ever stayed in. I heard no outside noise (helicopters, sirens etc.) and very little inside noise---nothing more than you get at any hotel.I did find the bartenders, dealers, waiters etc. etc. to be VERY accomodating. NY NY like most places lately has had layoffs so the folks who are left are those who have seniority and are good at their jobs. I found the service everywhere excellent.while here we ate at America twice. One dinner and one lunch. Both meals were excellent. We also tried 9 fine irishman for lunch and that was good also but not as stand out as America. If you're going here for the pool scene, don't. It's that simple. One of the smaller hotel pools on the Strip. Certainly acceptable for a quick dip or to lay in the sun but don't expect much if any action here.

Mar 29 2009 	Park Ave Deluxe room not so deluxe.	Stayed at NY,NY March 25th-28th and had booked an air and hotel package through Airtran Vacations. The package included the Park Ave Deluxe room, but it did not meet our expectations from the website description. It said it was 400 sq ft, but the bathroom door almost hit the toilet and you could barely walk between the bed and the combination entertainment center/wardrobe (there was no closet). We were on the 15th floor and had a view of the parking garage, a roof and the pool of you pressed your face against the window all the way to the left. Good view of the people in the roller coaster as they went whizzing by though. It was very clean and the furniture was nice, but I shudder to think what size the standard Skyline room was. Also, they did not ask if I would be interested in an upgrade, or ask our preferences, except for smoking or not, when we checked in.Also, the booking included 20% discounts at a couple of the bars and the NIne Five Irishmen Restaurant and $20 Free Play, but they couldn't find this info with my reservation. Luckily I had my itinerary and managed to get the Free Play, and they said when I charged the food and beverages to my room the discount would reflect on my final bill...nope. Had a hassle over that too. They were very nice and helpful in working it out, but I didn't expect all this time wasted on my trip.Also, I know it's Vegas, but food and drink is expensive. There aren't any deals for restaurants in NY,NY. Your best bet is to go next door to Excalibur and have the buffet. (You can buy an all day pass for $25.) Drinks cost $6 for a bottle of beer and $7 for a Bloody Mary. Went to Coyote Ugly and it was Happy Hour, 2 beers and 2 shots of Jack came to $20!!! It's legal to drink on the sidewalk, so we went down about 3 blocks to the mini mart and bought 24 oz cans for $3 each and walked the strip. (If we had a mini fridge in our room we would have stocked up.) When we were hanging out at NY, NY we played the penny machines and took every advantage of the free cocktails. We're not poor or cheap and understand the cost of living in other cities, but the prices in casinos are outrageous. We got married there 5 years ago and they were nothing like this.

Mar 29 2009 	A superb stay	This was our first visit to Las Vegas, so we wanted a hotel on "The Strip" that be comfortable but without breaking the Bank. The Check in desk was busy but it did not take long for us to get checked in, Check in staff were very friendly and helpful.Our room was a "Broadway Room" on the 25th Floor with a superb view of the southern end of The Strip. The room was large with two comfortable double beds and plenty of space. The bathroom, although not large was well equiped with soap, shampoo etc. The room was very clean and tidy. Internet access was availalble either by Wi-Fi or cable but there is a charge.The hotel has everything you could want, the Casino, shops and plenty of places to eat and drink. We used the Casino most evenings and although it was busy we never had any problems in finding something that suited us. We ate in the Irish Bar and also in the ESPN Zone bar on several occasions and the food was very good.The hotel is a short walk to the bus stop on The Strip and the "Deuce" service will take you anywhere along The Strip for $3 or $7 buys you an all day ticket.In summary, we had a relaxing stay in this superb hotel complex.

Mar 27 2009 	Excellent Hotel with Good Vibe in the Casino	Stayed here for 5 nights in March 2009. We were upgraded tot he Park Avenue Room which was roomy and the bed comfortable. We were in the Century Tower on the 21st Floor but lifts were very quick and efficient. We ate in Gallaghers Steakhouse in the Hotel which is one of several. Quite simply the best Fillet Steak I have ever tasted. Used the pool and it was excellent especially when the weather was warm, 3 spa pools, waitress service, DJ playing music. The Casino although not the biggest on the Strip has a great atmosphere and is always buzzing from Coyote Ugly, ESPN Zone, Village Street, Rok Las Vegas and the New Center Bar. Stay here you will not be dissapointed

Mar 27 2009 	Reasonably priced great location for seeing the sights	I stayed here for New Year's Eve with a group of friends. We booked the room online and took advantage of an extra night promotion advertised on their website. The rates were reasonable for a week's stay, considering it was New Year's Eve. The actual nightly rate for New Year's Eve was very steep (as pwere all the hotels in Las Vegas) but the free night promotion and the other night's rates averaged it out.There were four of us sharing our room. We opted for a Broadway Suite which was the 4th largest out of 7 rooms. The room was ok but pretty small for 4 people. We requested a rollaway bed for one of our party, twice before arriving. We then asked upon check in and they still did not bring it up until we called Reception yet again to remind them.The room was clean and basic, we did not spend a lot of time there so this was all we needed. Breakfast was not included but you can eat fantastic all-you-can eat buffets at most of the hotels in Vegas (we had a great champagne brunch buffet at the Flamingo and the best buffet in town, without a doubt was at the Rio....we'd never before seen so many varieties of food available!) There are plenty of restaurants, cages and fast food chains within the hotel itself. It's easy to pop downstairs for a quick bite to eat, an ice cream or even for a drink in one of the many bars.The hotel has loads to see and do. In Vegas each hotel is like a resort in itself. New York New York is really well themed and there are so many little details which really add to the feel of being in New York at the same time. The interior of the hotel is really well designed and replicates streets and monuments in New York. Each building which is part of the hotel is a replica of a famous building...the Chrysler Building, Statue of Liberty, Empire State, and so on. Having visited most of the main hotels in Vegas, I thought that theming-wise, New York New York was one of the most effective along with Paris and The Venetian.New York New York is a great base for sightseeing and has everything you could need to explore the Strip. It's within walking distance of the Mandalay Bay, Luxor and Excalibur at one end of the Strip (and even the famous Vegas Sign nearby) and then in the other direction is in walking distance of many more hotels including Paris, the Bellagio, Planet Hollywood, Caesars Palace, and more. The MGM Grand, directly opposite to New York New York, is linked by a walkway andcontains a monorail stop within the hotel. So it is very easy to get around from the hotel.I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a reasonably priced hotel that is quite centrally located on the Strip. Great place to explore Vegas.

Mar 26 2009 	Great Hotel!	I had called ahead of time to let them know an extra person was staying in the room, but once we arrived they had not prepared the room for that person. Once I called housekeeping, they were very friendly and quick to give us towels etc. There are some good restaurants at the bottom of the hotel, with a few open 24 hours, which is great when you are coming back late from a night out and you have the munchies! The bars are fun expecially when there were live bands playing. Convenient coffee shops, souvenir stores etc. The location is a little a way from the centre of the strip, but is still surrounded by other fun hotels with lots to do. Jumping in a taxi was the best way to get around as the buses were extremely slow. Overall, a great and very comfy stay!

Mar 25 2009 	Our room had been renovated	Stayed last night at New York, New York. Wanted to stay at Venetian or Mandolay Bay but read on Trip Advisor about the smell. We walked over to those two hotels and the reviewers were correct, it made me sick from the pumped in smell. It is to hide the cigarette smoke I think. How can people stay there? We were on the 26th floor of New York, New York and our room had new carpet, bedspreads and very nice sheets. The bathroom was nice. The room was very dark. Forget about reading in your room. It is like a cave due to only a couple of lights with energy saving bulbs. They do not want you in your room anyway, you are supposed to be gambling. The pool was open and it was fine. Plenty of room for everyone. I checked out on the TV in my room--two seconds. Why are people standing in line checking out?? There was one person in line in front of me during check-in. I will stay there again. PLEASE give us Wi-Fi in our rooms for Free. In the year 2009--to have to pay for that connection is absurd.

Mar 25 2009 	I Loved the Hotel	The hotel was amazing. Our first room didn't have any sort of view (parking lot) and they moved us to a great room the next day. Would have moved us right away but we wanted to stay on same floor as our friends. Staff were wonderful - especially front desk. Mar 24 2009 	Would recommend this hotel	Stayed at NYNY for 9 nights (second trip to Vegas) mid March 2009 and found the hotel to be great. Check in was a breeze and we had booked a Broadway Deluxe room with a strip view. The room was quite large and the bed very comfortable. Bathroom was nice but for some reason no exhast fan so mirrors were always fogged up. Maid service was sufficient and room always smelt fresh. As some other reviewers mentioned the walls are thin but over the 9 nights we only had rowdy neighbours for 1 night - hardly a major inconveniance. The hotel has lots of choices to eat and some great shops. Casino itself was large enough not to get lost in and always found a slot machine or position at roulette table. Dealers were friendly and made the gambling experience fun even if you lost. Drink service while gambling was sometimes slow but if you tip well they would keep them coming. Overall I would recommend NYNY - it is at the end of the strip but is close to many other hotels (MGM, Excalibur, Luxor, Monte Carlo and Tropicana) regardless of where you stay you will have to walk or navigate down the strip at some stage. The major tip I would give people if you plan to gamble at NYNY and their partner hotels (Bellagio, MGM, Mandalay Bay, The Mirage, Luxor and many others) is to sign up for a players card straight away - we were only told about it by a roulette dealer on our third last day and during those three days of table and slot play were able to receive 2 nights out of our nine for free, a $50 voucher at America restaurant and $20 of free slot play. If we had of signed up on our first day I am positive most of our accommodation cost would have been comped. Check out was a breeze and Bell Service quick and friendly.

Mar 22 2009 	Just OK.	The outside of the hotel is gorgeous, with the NYC skyline, and it continues its looks on the inside. We travelled during March Break, which might have been part of the problems we had. Granted, I can't blame the hotel for my nrighbours, however the walls were so thin. Not only could we hear their conversations, but we could hear their phone ringing. Also, we were annoyed to realise the mornig we were checking out, that hotel guests got 10% off meals at a couple of the restaurants inside the hotel. We ate at those restaurants 3 times, at it was neevr mentioned! Overall, its a nice hotel, but I didn't like the service we received, or the really thin walls. However, I will give credit where credit is due, and the interior at the back of the hotel is amazing! Its like they rebuilt NYC inside the hotel with all the little shops and stores. That blew me away!

Mar 18 2009 	Staying further down the strip next time	This was the first time in Vegas for me and I was completely amazed! The NY,NY is almost to the end of the strip, it's a lot of walking but right across the street is the MGM and they havea monorail stop (ride it, trust me). The room was nice sized but I do believe it was decorated either in the dark or by a blind person. Not to sound picky or anything but it was loud! We went to the America restaurant one night, not the best but was a decent meal, and we went at 11pm so... Mar 18 2009 	Great hotel Comfy beds Great Service!	We just got back from our Trip to Vegas March 9-13th. My boyfriend and I had never been to Vegas so we weren't really sure where to stay. We booked our vacation with WestJet vacations and they did a great job of giving us lots of different hotel options for a great price. We chose the New York New York because it looked hip, fun, and was decently priced. We arrived in Vegas at 10:00pm and had about a 10 minute wait at check-in. The check-in lady was VERY nice and got us checked in promptly. She even upgraded us to a Park Avenue Deluxe room for free. (We had booked a Skyline room) We got just what we had asked for-a non-smoking room with a King size bed. We stayed in the NyNy Tower room 1110 and the view was amazing. If you are older or have kids I wouldn't suggest asking how far of a walk the room is from the elevator, because my boyfriend and I are both physically able to walk perfectly fine and found it to be a very long walk to the elevator from our room.Our room was great. VERY clean, shower worked well (good pressure) and the bed was EXTREMELY comfortable. I haven't slept that well in a while. The mandatory $3 a night fee for the telephone came in handy because we made many phone calls to get show tickets/times/reservations. When we couldn't find any extra pillows we called down to housekeeping and they brought us up some extra ones along with extra towels within 5 minutes of me making the call. GREAT service!There were only two things we didn't like about the room. 1. The shower doesn't drain very well. It wasn't until we got back to Ottawa that we realized that they actually do this on purpose to try to get you to conserve the water. (You end up soaking your feet while you're showering basically)2. Our room was overlooking the rollercoaster so you would hear a lot of rattling from the metal and some yelling from the riders. It wasn't unbareable by any means, but it may be a nuisance for some people. The hotel itself has lots of great food options and they really try to keep with the NY theme. Casinos are all really smokey and the hotel always seemed really busy.The night before we checked out we called down to the desk to see if a late check-out would be a possibility. They allowed us to check-out at twelve noon even though check-out was supposed to be at 11am. Our flight only left at 11:30pm that night so we had a long day and wanted to check out as late as possible. Upon check out, we had some luggage we needed to put aside so we brought it to the Bell Desk and they dealt with it very quickly and stored it away safely. It was fast and friendly.Upon check-out we only waited about 3 minutes and the lady at the check-out counter simply asked for our names and then told us we could keep the key as a souvenir, and thanked us for staying there. That was it. Simple and fast.My boyfriend and I are not fussy travelers and we are satisfied if our bed is comfortable enough to fall asleep in, the room is clean and that we feel safe throughout our stay. We were very pleased with our stay at the New York New York

Mar 17 2009 	Great location and value. Rooms are questionable.	We stayed in the spa suite. The bed was very uncomfortable and we could hear everything going on around us. The huge tub with surrounding mirrors was great, but that was the ONLY highlight.

No one apologized. Being in the business I know what happened! I was told they would move us between 9 am and 11 am the next day. When I called the next morning at 10 am the desk told me that they didn't do room moves until between 1pm and 3 pm! Slight lack of communication or the desk person at night didn't want to deal with me anymore. I was put through to a manager and guess what -there was a room available immediately. Why do guests have to get really upset and go to managers before anything happens. Just a quick note- the strip view is not worth it-window very small and you had to climb around furniture to see anything. Our standard room had floor to ceiling windows with a decent view. We had a buffet breakfast in the small restaurant the first morning and I would definitely not recommend it. The selection was limited and the price high. I would absolutely recommend the America restaurant. Service was amazing and the food excellent. The casino was small, crowded and noisy due to the night clubs. Tables were very quiet.I asked for a late check out and was willing to pay for it but was told to come back the day before we were due to depart. I was told it would cost between $50 and $65. Went back the day before departure and was told "no we don't do that until the day of departure"! Oh and the rate would be some place between $60 and $119. Guess what on day of departure I was told sorry ( at least I got the apology) no late check outs! Again a total lack of communication and no service. Quite frankly, while the rooms are a high quality, Circus Circus, 4 Queens, the Venetian and the Stratosphere all have better service. Next time will stay at a different hotel.

Mar 4 2009 	Good for its location and restaurant choices	Rooms are OK. Staff are reasonably friendly. Travellers should be aware of the room rates as they change daily. You might have booked it more expensively than what it is when you arrive. I find this kind of pricing policy annoying, to say the least. How about introducing a lowest rate guarantee?? The casino was OK, but most dealers were not exceedingly friendly. You might do better elsewhere, e.g. at the Bellagio, etc.The reason I chose this hotel was for its access to the Cirque du Soleil shows (i.e. Ka, Zoomanity), which you can easily reach on foot or take the bus to the Bellagio (for O).There are also lots of eateries downstairs and at the other hotels nearby. My favourite was the Mexican place 'Gonzales Gonzales' for the food, not for the service however.Another plus point for this hotel is the relatively clean air. Some hotels, such as the Venitian or Mandalay Bay, seem to have the idea that an attack of chemical smells throughout their premises will increase guest comfort or make them spend more at the games. Sorry to the psychologists who thought this up, but it just induces feelings of nausea and puts people through an olfactory stress test. In summary, this is a good place to base yourself for visiting the major attractions this town has to offer. Definitely go and see the shows! They are world class.

Mar 1 2009 	New York - New York Hotel and Casino	We stayed here for 3 nights (Fri., Sat., Sun.,) over Valentine's Day weekend in 2009.We waited about 5 minutes in line to check in. We thought that they would have said something being a lucky number, but nothing was mentioned. The room was a standard hotel room with a king size bed. The view from the window was of wall. We saw the housekeeper every day on our way out, and she always asked if we wanted service or not, as well, we had our sign out.There is a small restaurant that has a breakfast buffet in the morning, but the buffet is extremely small with very few choices - you are better off walking next door to the Excalibur or Luxor for a "real" Las Vegas buffet. There were several other restaurants and bars within the New York -New York, including numerous quick food choices. We did not eat at any of these.There is an outside walk way/ bridge from the New York -New York to the Excalibur hotel/casino, and then the Excalibur has inside walking to the Luxor and then inside walking from the Luxor to the Mandalay Bay. Feb 11 2009 	Great Place with a few reservations.	My sig/other and I stayed at NYNY for 4 nights, and enjoyed our stay with a few caveats: 1) Though we enjoyed ourselves (we are a 50-something couple), the atmosphere really is geared toward the 20-30 year old crowd. Though I loved that it wasn't so big that we got lost but large enough to be an experience, I was not aware of the party attitude of the place and wasn't looking for it., but our room in the Century tower was quiet and that was all that mattered to us. 2) The sales reps! I did ask the desk clerk to perhaps mention it to the manager and will also follow up with a email (not that it will probably do any good). They are the ones selling time shares, and got quite aggressive with us--even hostile when we tried to ignore them. One has to run the gauntlet in most of the hotels we visited, so it's not just NYNY, but there I had to put up with one of the sales guys sticking a card in my (then) winning slot, only for it to go south almost as soon as he did. Bummer! I got real sick of them real fast, and don't know why the hotels are allowing them on-property. Other than that, our check-in was around 11 p.m. and went relatively quick--no last minute surprises. Our check-out for us was at 6 a.m. in order to catch a flight, and went even faster. The room we were given was slightly upgraded from the one I booked, for whatever reason--but we aren't complaining! We ended with a Park Avenue room. It was very nice, and came with the hair dryer. Room service was attentive and the room well taken care of.As a matter of fact, the entire hotel was cleaner than one would think given the amount of foot traffic going through. We went across the walk-way to Excalibur and was dismayed at the mess. Of all the places we visited, I did like NYNY best for cleanliness and friendlier atmosphere. We didn't eat at the restaurants there, but did enjoy the non-Starbucks coffee shop in the food court.I recommend NYNY for those who don't mind being on the south end of the strip and those who don't mind mingling with the younger crowds.We were there from Friday evening until Tuesday morning, and weren't bothered by prostitutes, though my sig/other was hit up for a smoke (he doesn't smoke) by a snakey looking character. But that was the extend of that. NYNY is convenient to Excalibur, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and MGM Grand.

The time it took to check in was minimal. However, the time it took to sign up for a players card was ridiculous! The casino slots were very tight. Didn't see anyone hitting anything of substance. The tables weren't busy. We participated in the black jack tourney (1st time for both in a tourney) and took 2nd and 3rd place. That was fun for only a $20 entry fee.  The best and funnest bar at NY NY is the Bar at Times Square!!! What a blast. It's the sing along with the dueling piano guys. If you get there early enough, you won't have to pay the $10 cover.
