Nov 12 2008 	Short Stay at NYNY	Since I don't gamble, I am not really a Las Vegas person. However, my wife was attending a brief sorority reunion at the New York New York in Las Vegas, and basically demanded that I come along.New York New York seems to be fairly typical of the huge Strip hotels - thousands of rooms, numerous restaurants and shops, and a casino. Las Vegas appears to be hurting financially right now (Fall 08). We were upgraded to a 2nd tier room for the basic price and given some free and 2-for-1 coupons. Several locals said business is way down the last 6 months, so hotels may be hurting for business with all those rooms to fill.The room was nice enough, with a comfortable bed. There were a few chintzy touches - the shower doors didn't work properly and the television receives surprisingly few channels, but there were no major problems. Staying at the NYNY is probably similar to staying at any of the other big Strip hotels, so shop around.
Nov 12 2008	New York New York: Good Room Weak Casino	While the room was clean and more spacious than most hotel rooms, the casino itself lacks luster.

Nov 11 2008	Could have been better	My husband and I stayed there for our honeymoon. Like some previous reviews have mentioned, the basic room is super small. We were upgraded because on our first morning there we were woken up by some construction. That's right...some of the other more recent reviews have mentioned construction. Well it looks like a year later they're still at it. They still required hotel guests to leave a credit card number to use their internet. I can't believe a huge casino still charges for internet use. Get with the program. Needless to say we did not hang out at our casino for very long. We ventured out and about more than we were in the room. Oh yeah...steer clear of their roller coaster. The shoulder rests left indentions and popped some veins in my husband's shoulders that were bright red for a week after he rode the thing.

Nov 11 2008	Good Choice	We stayed at NYNY 3 nights mid Oct, in a double queen bed room for 2 couples. Arrived in early afternoon, and we had booked a non smoking, but they only had a smoking room, so we took it, rather than wait. Thankfully, the room didn't smell, as I am really sensitive to smoke!! Room size was great, with good sized beds and bathroom. However, by this stage, for the money we were spending in 4-5 star hotels, I was getting a little tired of showers over baths, and this is something I would research a little better for next trip. These configurations, especially when old, are terrible - they have very limited adjustments(pressure/temp) and the spray type can sometimes be uncomfortable...not good when your paying top dollar. This was the 3rd leg of our trip, from LA, SAN FRAN. We were booked in to get married at Stratosphere on the last day, and this turned out to be a great experience for an informal type ceremony. The hotel is located at the southern end of strip, which makes for some lengthy walking if you want to explore the 'newer' looking casino's. Not to say NYNY looks overly old itself. However, be prepared for the imposing, rude and extremely annoying sidewalk antics of people attempting to hand out 'escort /prostitute services literature. I found this really awkward, walking up and down the strip with my fiance/wife, and my friends. On the 1st night, when walking back to our hotel, one of these guys said something in Spanish, of course, to my partners sister. I couldn't help myself and swore at him. He heard me, and we almost got into a fight, when the lights changed, he kicked me and ran off. I would have been hesitant to retaliate, with so many of them there. This left a foul taste in my mouth about Vegas generally, and that confirmed to me I would never come back. However, next day upon a cancelled trip to the canyon, because of a mix up, I used the Hotel gym - for an additional 18USD!!!, (GREAT GYM THOUGH) and had a mini bucks night out - blackjack at Caesars Palace with pussycat doll dancers! I don't gamble - first time player, and I won 130 BUCKS - I was very happy!!! The girls went to Cirque show and absolutely loved it! That evening we all ate togethr inside Venetian. This was fantastic - beautiful interior - my favourite, and a variety of 'normal' priced restaurants. I found it very hard, walking through other casino's, to find a well priced eatery. The Venetian however, was at the opposite end of the strip to NYNY, and thus I would aim to stay here, if I went back. America,good priced eatery in NYNY, as was Rainforest in MGM across the road. There was even an Australian I think 'Outback' restaurant which was open late down the strip which was good. Ate lunch at Stratosphere Top of the world before wedding and it was really nice, and great value...you'd pay similar anywhere on the strip and here you are on a revolving restaurant high in the sky - brilliant! After the ceremony etc I booked us in at PANEVINO near the airport, with a great view of the strip. For a lovely meal, treat yourself to this place, an excellent, after wedding dinner!! The Mirage was pretty cool on the inside, and would like to see their wildlife habitats if we returned. If only the local authorities stepped in and got rid of those annoying literature/ticket dispensers!!! Oh, my partner and friend went on the roller coaster on the last night and said it was a buzz! Gym at cost of 18 dollars is a bit cheeky, would be good to know that up front, and also internet minimum of 5 dollars too. Overall, a nice establishment, but I preffered the other end of the strip and thus would either stay at that end, or look into the Marriott properties, which the cab driver told us are great, off the strip.

Nov 5 2008 	Loved New York New York	What an experience! I will definately stay there again next year. The hotel staff was top notch. Even the housekeeping employees were so polite and friendly. There was plenty to do and lots of restaurants to choose from. If you do end up staying there, you have got to eat at Gallager's steakhouse. DELICIOUS! It was my first time in Las Vegas and I am so happy to be fortunate enough to stay at New York New York!

Nov 5 2008 	Nice hotel on the strip	The hotel was allright - nothing fancy. It is right on the strip, the room was big enough, but it could use a better cleaning. Service staff was good. After all I would say it is a little bit too much money for what you get...

Nov 3 2008 	No problems but nothing special either.	I booked 3 nights in July for my birthday. The girlfriend was along for this trip. We checked in in about 20 minutes. They were working on some construction in the lobby which maybe finished by now. Our room was clean if not the biggest. They wanted extra for internet access which I have not seen in several years now. In the evenings the Casino lobby area gets crowded. People every where. Sometimes it is hard to walk through. Be careful not to get separated from your party. Most of the clientele looked like they were from NY. T-shirts gold chains tattoos. Not a classy crowd.The first evening we walked around the Casino. The food and drinks are very pricey - like NY. The next day we ventured out onto the strip.We soon discovered some gems. Reasonable beer food etc. Bills Gambling Hall. Much classy places like Caesars and the Venetian.Vegas has plenty. Next trip we're staying in old downtown Vegas.

Oct 30 2008 	Fun at New York New York	We booked our room through vegas.com for 3 nights for a rate we considered good value. The room was a decent size and the amenities nice (although a fridge would have been useful). The location of the hotel is convenient for accessing the Strip. The restaurants in the hotel/casino are pricey and the quality varies from venue to venue. The roller coaster was great fun!Staff were friendly and helpful.Overall a fun place to stay in Vegas.

Oct 30 2008 	Nice hotel nice upgrade!	Stayed at the NY NY in May 2008. It was very nice - the casino is great - but I still preferred the MGM across the street. The first night we stayed in the basic room - and it was soooooooo small! I wasn't very happy, but they would not upgrade us at all. The second night, we used our points to upgrade to the Ziggarat Suite. This suite was bigger than some apartments I have been in! The windows were tinted green, which was different - but kinda cool. The bed was amazing! The jacuzzi was a 4 person tub and came with bath beads - so great! We got slippers and bathrobes - and chocolate cherries at turndown service time. The restaurants in the casino were okay - a little pricey - but thats not uncommon in Vegas. We ate at the pizza place and the ESPN Zone - both were pretty good. But, if you want a great buffet - go next door to the Exalibur - it was great and a decent price. We also got a free breakfast at the MGM which was awesome as well!I would definitely go back to Vegas - but I think I would stay at the MGM over the NY NY. I really would like to try out the Venetian, Mirage or the Wynn. Those are mid-strip and close to all the action. The NYNY & MGM are about a 5-10 min walk to the middle of the strip which isn't bad at all!

Oct 29 2008 	Yes I was surprised that...	....I was surprised that I actually enjoyed my stay. After reading a few not so great reviews, I was pleasantly surprised with our visit to NY NY. We stayed on the 6th floor in the New Yorker Tower (which is a great location by the way!) Awesome view of the air conditioners (LOL). The room was dark, but tastefully decorated. Not as old as I thought it would be. No stains, no dings in the wall, no shower mildew. Pretty nice. We had dinner at Gallagers and Il Fornaio (sp) and had lunch at America. All were decent. There is some construction going on right in the center of the casino, not a big space, but, it does make you walk around. Hopefully they are adding a nice sit down lounge area. Most of the changes that they have made to the resort/casino are good. However there really is no place just to lounge, sit back and relax. Not a lot of energy in the place!Overall a great stay - easy access to all that there is on the South Strip!

Oct 27 2008 	We had a brilliant time	Had looked at all the reviews on Trip Advisor for Vegas prior to booking, We were not disappointed - had contacted the hotel regarding upgrading - special occasion - all dealt with. Checking-in very swift and very customer focused. Got a room with a strip view - clean, good size, suited us well. OK the television didn't have many channels , and there is no tea/ coffee facilities in the room - but who is going to stay in their room when there is so much to see and do. We booked Mama Mia , and Barry Manilow - great evenings, but the highlight was the Grand Canyon trip with Sundance helicopter company. Picked up from the hotel in a limo - smooth ride in the chopper, right mix of commentary and chat by the pilot - and then a picnic on the canyon floor - and if that wasn't enough -the final flight back along the strip. Some quick tips. Use the deuce bus system - great value - and you see all the sights on $5 for 24 hours Must go and see the Fremont Street experience Buffets at the Monty Carlo great value

Oct 17 2008 	NYNY ROX!	We arrived on Thursday, Oct 9th, my friend had VIP check in through the frosted glass, we had to wait awhile but we were served drinks and they had selection of nuts and candies, fruit and coffee, tea, water, very nice. After a few min, there was a mishap with my friend, so we actually had another friend give us her keys, it was a PARK AVENUE room in the NEW YORK TOWER, the elevator bank was just across from Galaghers. We had room 3850 or 3950 ( cant remember ) but it was a corner room and right around the corner of the elevators! The room was big, 2 queen beds, 2 chairs and a small table , a comfy bench by the curtains, the entertainment center had 2 clostes, and the TV was not updated, just a standard tube TV. The view was amazing, we had MGM on one sideand Monte Carlo on another, since it was a corner room we had all around view. The bathroom was small, the shower/tub was all in one, with marble, VERY SLIPPERY, make sure to put some towles on the floor!  There was a desk in between the beds, with a phone and a small desk lamp, my aunt really enjoyed the 15x magnifying make up mirror in the bathroom. The only thing negative is that they leave messages everyday, to tell you about sales in the gift shop. I left housekeeping a note with tip each day and they left us our chocolates on the made up bed and extra towels and toiletries! I would come back and stay here most definately! They had construction going on in the casino ,but it wasnt annoying and the music from the club lasted all night while we were playing in the casino.

Oct 15 2008 	Fun place to stay	This was our first trip to Vegas, and my friend came in from France for the trip. I booked this through a travel agent and really had no idea what to expect, but was told that this a good value for the money -- not the absolute cream of the crop, but decent. I would have to agree. Our room in the New York Tower was average -- not great, but clean and warm. Just a little bit worn and not new. I was surprised there wasn't a mini-bar in it. The view was great, we overlooked the strip. The people of the hotel were top-notch, everyone was friendly, smiling and helpful. This included the staff during check-in and check-out, the people at the Zumanity box office, and the casino people who were quick to help when a machine malfunctioned and didn't give me my $9 winnings. :) The location was great. One complaint is that we were given a 2 for 1 coupon at Il Fornaio restaurant for patio breakfast before 10:30am. It turns out there are TWO Il Fornaio's in the hotel. We stood in line at the wrong one for a time, and when we got the the RIGHT one at 10:33, the man said it was too late for breakfast and wouldn't serve us. He was actually quite rude, the only person we encountered like that during our trip. The live music at the Times Square Bar was a gas, and there was a 24-hr restaurant which we made use of a couple of times, All in all, I'd definitely stay there again.

Oct 12 2008 	Great Time	My husband, My Godmother, Mother and I stayed at NYNY from October 6th to October 10th. The hotel was great my husband and I had a spa suite for the first three nights and the Park Avenue room with premium view for the last night. The Spa suite was great it was spacious and had a great view of the strip we really enjoyed the Jacuzzi in the room it was very nice to relax after walking the strip all day long. The Park Avenue room was okay it also had a nice view but it was a little small and the TV wasnt great. Checking in was very easy and smooth we stayed in the Century tower and it was a great location. We ordered room service a few times and we all thought it was very good even with the high prices. We didnt really eat that much but the ESPN Zone was pretty cool the baseball games on Friday night. They were very fast and the food was okit was a little pricey. We also tried the America restaurant this was a great restaurant the food wasnt that expensive and they give you huge portions and they have a huge variety to chose from. The casino was very nice it was a little on the small side with the construction going on but it wasnt too crowded and the staff was very friendly. Rok night club was really cool and we didnt go to the Times Square bar but every time we walked by seemed like everyone was having a blast. We went to check out the roller coaster and it was 16.00 bucks to ride it kind of pricey if you ask me and just beware if you are in some of the rooms you can hear the roller coaster and the people yelling on the roller coaster late at night. I would say the only downfall for this hotel was the pool area it was way to small and you had to get out there really close to 10am when they opened or you wouldnt get a seat and the sun doesnt come over the pool until about noon. Check out was great and our flight didnt leave until 1130pm so they held our bags for us and got them within seconds when we had to leave to get to the airport. Oh and one last thing I wouldnt suggest taking the bus it was terrible. If you have any questions please feel free to email me at [-].

Oct 11 2008 	Loved our stay at New York New york	We have just stayed here for 10days on the 15th sept 08 and loved every second.There were 4 of us aged between 22 and 28 and there was plenty for all of us to do.Check in was quick and although there is some construction in the main entrance this didn't matter at all.All the staff were polite and helpful.Our rooms were on the 4th floor and were both very clean, maid service was excellent, clean towels every dayThis was our first time in Vegas and to be honest i think this hotel is in one of the better locations along the strip. You have the MGM opposite as well as the Bellagio up the street and a 24hour pharmacy(which to us from England is a 24hour supermarket)next door. The only problem is picking where to eat in the evenings as there are so many to choose from in all the hotels and if you are anything like me and my partner you don't want to feel uncomfortable in a posh restaurant. i would recommend the American Diner near reception in NYNY as they have so many different dishes you can never have the same thing twice.Will be coming back here again on our next Holiday to Vegas!!

Oct 9 2008 	I guess it was just OK	I'll start out by saying were are in the wrong age group to enjoy this hotel. We saw very few other 50 year olds here. I would imagine it would be a fun place to party but our party days are long over.We were offered a free three night stay. The room was to be newly refurbished.........which it certainly was not. The room itself was OK. Very dark and not too special in any way, but OK. They tried to sell us an upgrade, but we didn't care to. The food court is cool, and the food rather tasty. I just didn't find anything I could get excited about. Everything was just...............OK.I need to say the pool area was small and far form OK. It seemed dirty to me.We were spoiled by staying at the treasure island hotel last time. I much prefer the Monte Carlo to New York .

Oct 7 2008	Rooms not comfortable	Ok, you come in and there's construction in the main lobby; makes it difficult to get around. Not a major deal. Line to check in was fast. we upgraded to a spa room. They would not give us the web rate for the upgrade. Our first room was ventilated with smoke from the steakhouse 18 floors below. it was clean, but the tv did not work, the bed was very uncomfortable such that both of us woke up numerous times in the night just to turn over. THERE ARE NO COFFEE MAKERS IN ANY ROOMS. Also, you get charged $14 day for internet access. Apparently the hotel wants you out of your room as much as possible, and in the casino. When I complained, they put us in a wheelchair accessible room. It was ok. The bed was more comfortable, the tv worked. Still no coffee maker. Had I known, I would have brought my own. I did not go to the fancy restaurants or the shows or the nightclub. I looked over the Arcade, and heaven help any adults who have to go there. Much like Chuckie Cheese, you play games for tickets which can be used to buy prizes. The America restaurant was pretty good. Price not bad and food was good. the food court area was about what you would expect - pricey and not that good. The shops were average. We had fun with the digital photo booth which puts your face on other people's bodies -- Marilyn Monroe, show girls and others. The pool was nice, but crowded. We did not make it next door to the topless pool. :)While it is very close to the airport, it is over $20 to get to Freemont street one way. Next time, I will look for a place closer in. With a coffee maker in the room.

Oct 7 2008 	Loved it!!!!	We have just got back from a weeks stay at this hotel. We had the best time ever! I went with my partner, we are 25 & 29 and it was a perfect hotel for our age. The entertainment was great. We like a drink so this hotel was the place to be. The rooms were basic but contempory and perfect for what we needed it for.I only have one complaint about this hotel and that is the pool area. For a hotel with 2000 rooms the pool area is very small and because of the where the sun rose the pool did not get sunshine until 12noon and then it was lost again by 4pm. Obviously there is so much to do other than sunbathe but as a sun worshipper myself i would have preffered to be able to sunbathe for longer.Apart from that we had the best time ever!

Oct 7 2008 	You get what you pay for.	I stayed at New York New York Casino for 6 nights when travelling to the USA for business and had an enjoyable stay. Check-in was pretty swift, but we did arrive on Sunday afternoon. I noticed that during peak times (Thurs/Fri) the arrivals line was pretty long.I stayed in rm 2963 in the New Yorker Towers. The room was spacious, with two queen sized beds, a sitting area/desk and the bathroom was also quite spacious. When I arrived the room was clean and tidy. The view from my window was of the Monte Carlo and traffic, but it was a quiet at night. The only negative to this room is that no tea/coffee facilities are provided in the room, you have to purchase this from one of the various cafe's/restaurants in the casino.The casino has a variety of eateries so you will never be without food! The only negative is that smoking is allowed in all casinos, so for a non-smoker it did at times get a little overbearing, particularly when over populated.The location of this hotel is really what you pay for. Conveniently located at the good end of the strip, you are close to MGM, Paris, PH Casino, Bellagio etc. There is a Walgreens a short walk away and the "Coke Bottle" building where you can purchase half price tickets for many of the shows.

Oct 6 2008 	Not Bad	Spent the night before my wedding day here as well as our wedding night. Room I stayed in for the day before the wedding was not bad. Not a great view but I did get to see the people on the roller coasters funny faces as they flew by.My husband and I got a marquis spa suite (I think that was what it was called) for the night of the wedding.Wasn't that impressed to be honest with you. The whirlpool tub was awesome but the air conditioner didn't even work. We got to our room at about 11:00 p.m. and dropped off some of our things and headed to the casino. We returned at about 3:00 a.m. before we noticed the A/C wasn't working. It was a HOT night and not due to our first night as man and wife either. Room was huge but seemed rather empty and the couch was a rather dingy. Not worth the money my parents forked out to give us a spa suite.I loved the times square area of this hotel was pretty neat and had many different little restaurants to visit.All in all our stay was about a 3.5

Oct 6 2008	Average	Our first stay in Vegas, we were expecting razzle-dazzle and a fantastic room. But, you get what you pay for and at $89 per night it wasn't that bad deal in hindsight.There was a problem was with check-in which took 1.5 hours of sitting around in an un-serviced room calling the front desk/housekeeping to figure out.The bed was clean and comfortable and once housekeeping figured out that the room was occupied there was no problem with room-servicing. The room was really dark, and although the view wasn't bad (on to the MGM Grand/Excalibur corner) there was some noise from outside - not as we expected from the roller coaster, but from the Excalibur and (possibly) the ads running on the walkway to the MGM Grand and traffic. It wasn't a huge problem - earplugs help - but this was on the 15th floor and we weren't expecting it!The cafes and bars within the hotel were okay though Gallaghers and Il Fornaio were pricey. Chin-Chin deserves special mention - we ate dinner and breakfast here and were impressed with both. The casino was a disappointment. There was some construction work going on in the middle of it which was boarded off, so it was perhaps smaller than usual, but if you want poker and a little more atmosphere out of your casino, try the MGM Grand over the walkway. We rarely used the casino at NYNY.On the whole it was a fun stay, because Vegas is fun. But we weren't blown away by New York New York and wouldn't rush to stay there again.

Oct 4 2008 	Pleasantly surprised	Stayed one night. Booked special rate via email from MGM properties and included upgraded from Park Ave to Century room,breakfast discount and arrival cocktails. The Century tower room was clean, nice furnishings and great view of the strip. Room 3342 was end of hall, but not too far from elevator and had perfect view on Las Vegas Blvd and Tropicana Blvd. Elevators were fast as they were exclusive to higher floors. Compares to the Mirage (stayed there about one yr ago) but less expensive.

Oct 3 2008 	NY-NY what a wonder town!	This was our first experience at NYNY and we heard a few comments that were less then flattering. So, we arrived saturday about 1PM. Check in was quick, efficient and friendly.We were extremley pleased with our room (which we didn't upgrade). It had new fixtures, nice furniture, very clean and the king size bed and pillows were great!Now the room wasn't real big, but it was just fine for us. The house keeping department was really good. Every morning, our room was prepared earlier and everything was very clean!We ate at several restaurants, Gallighers, American Cafe, Pizza shop (I forget the name), Starbucks and all were quick, friendly and high quality. Needless to say, I give this place 5 stars! We can't wait to go back next year!

Oct 3 2008 	Very average	We stayed here because it was central to most things on the strip and the rooms looked basic on the website which we didn't mind as we presumed we wouldn't be in the room much anyway. Oct 3 2008 	New York New York is Great Fun	New York New York is great fun. We arrived around five and checked in with no problems. Oct 2 2008 	Loved New York New York	Great atmosphere, friendly staff, many options for eating, good pool, helpful staff. Would recommend and stay again.

Oct 1 2008 	Smashing	Stayed here for 5 nights in early September. Arrived about 9 at night after a long flight from the UK, and was able to walk straight up to check-in, which was a surprise given it was a Saturday night. Had really good room on 28th floor, near to lift. View was of the car park, but who cares - you don't come to Vegas to spend time (except for sleeping) in your room.Noise in casino could be off-putting, but didn't spend time in there during the day as sightseeing. During the evening, no construction work. Only noise is from "Nine Fine Irishmen", "Times Square", and people generally enjoying themselves.Saw Carrott Top at Luxor, and Zumanity at NYNY. Sep 30 2008 	Enjoyed our stay at the NYNY	Stayed here from 9/24 -/9/29. This was the fourth hotel we stayed it during a 12 day Las Vegas/LA/Las Vegas trip and we were not disappointed. We received an email offer and got a super rate of $49/night for weekday and $79/weekend which is unheard of for a Strip hotel.Check in on 9/24 was a breeze and we received the exact king non smoking room we requested. We stayed on the 27th floor of the Century tower. The noise of the roller coaster was not really an issue since we were well above it, but I could see where it might be loud if you had a lower floor. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. One thing we really noticed about the NYNY that is different from all other LV hotels was how quiet the room is. The hallways are not a straight linelike in most hotels. There are twists and turns that follow the unique shape of the building and this tends to makes sounds in the hallway not travel so far. Also, I noticed that the doors to the rooms don't slam like in other hotels which was nice.We visited the pool a couple of times and it was ok, but nothing spectacular. We don't like sitting in the sun, so were actually happy that the pool is shaded for a lot of the time. Call us crazy. I could see where the pool would get very crowded at other times of the year though. There is not a lot of room for chairs and it does look like it would be cramped.We like the location of the NYNY on the Strip because it is easy to walk over the bridges to MGM, Excalibur or Tropicana.There is still work being done in the casino. They have torn out the old replica Cnetral Park that used to be in the center of the casino floor and are still working on it. We didn't really care too much about this since we don't tend to stay in any one casino very long anyway.Checkout was a breeze and without incident. Overall, I would stay at the NYNY again, especially if we received such a great room deal.

Sep 29 2008 	Super	We went there for 3 nights.Rooms were big and comfortable. Very clean...Beds matras was soft.Only internet was payable, disappointing for this kind of hotel.Casino was fun and the new nightclub ROK was fun, fun fun!!!Breakfast was not what we expected. No buffet service what we were told.

Sep 29 2008 	Great Stay	Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights from 11 September. We arrived to find our room was not ready but were told to return at 3.00 when it would be. When we returned at the designated time the room was ready. Had a Broadway Deluxe room overlooking the MGM on 12th floor. Had no problem with any noise from outside or other guests. The room was spacious, clean with enough storage space and a huge tv - which we did not use as there were better things to do. Only had breakfast in the hotel - Il Fornio where the coffee and toasted sandwiches were fantastic. The hotel does not have a large shopping malls as others further along the strip have but this to me was an advantage as it reduced the number of people visiting the hotel. The customer services guy we spoke to was always willing to help us plan our days with advice on the best way to get to off strip locations. One tip if you are into Pinball then you must visit the Pinball Museum where you will find lots of different machines of different ages which you can still play! Did not play the tables here as for an amateur the minimum bet on the table was too high but would recommend the TI where the mins are lower. Also as there was no queue at check in in the evening I would recommend settling your account the night before you leave to avoid the queues in the morining. For a reasonable hotel in a great location this is the place to stay

Sep 28 2008 	Great Hotel	It has taken me awhile to write this review but here it is. To start with, the short cab ride to the hotel was quick and easy. There was a lengthy line at 1 PM on saturday to check in but after 20 minutes our room was ready early. Perfect. The rooms were your average hotel room. Nothing special, but clean, quiet and comfortable. Our room looked out over the pool and you could see the mountains in the distance, which was a decent view. The beds were comfortable and our rooms were made up perfect everyday, and believe me we made a mess day in and day out. We were on the 12 floor and the elevators were very quick and almost always available. The casino was great some construction but the atmosphere was lively. Typical strip minimums on the tables and tight slots, at least i thought but still had a great time. Location is the south end of the strip and right across from MGM Grand and a short walk to excalibur and from there you can take the free train to luxor and mandelay bay. Hotel amenities are great and gallaghers steak house was amazing. I had the prime rib and it very good. The food court also had good choices as did nine fine irishmen. Entertainment was great i liked the piano bar and ESPN Zone. All in all it was a great hotel and a great trip. For the reasonable price i would say you get your moneys worth.

Sep 25 2008 	Would Stay Again	Even though its almost been a year since I've been there. I have to say I really enjoyed New York-New York. I still talk about it today. I would love to go again. Sep 24 2008 	good for the price!	We stayed for 6 days, 5 nights in September and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. While it's not a luxury hotel like the Bellagio or Caesar's, it's definitely a good deal! The location is great, right across from the MGM Grand and it's facade is beautiful, with a replica of the Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty and the New York City skyline. The roller coaster was fun although a bit of a rocky ride. We booked through vegas.com and got upgraded to a nicer room with a bunch of coupons (e.g. 2 for 1 breakfast at Il Fornaio, 2 for 1 roller coaster rides, 2 free cocktails, etc.). The rooms were clean and fairly spacious, with a beautiful marble bathroom, comfortable beds and plenty of down pillows. The only complaint about the room was that there was no fan in the bathroom, so the mirror always fogged up after a shower. We were also missing basic amenities (shampoo, soap, etc.) when we checked in, but a quick call to housekeeping solved the problem, and it never happened again during our stay. We also got fresh towels every day, even though we didn't request it. Although I appreciated this touch, I was slightly bothered by the fact that my attempt to be environmental was ignored by the staff; perhaps the daily tip made him/her want to go the extra mile?The casino was small in comparison to some of the other hotels and there was still a lot of construction noise as they were finishing up Rok nightclub at the start of our visit, but that quickly cleared up halfway through our trip. The restaurants were interesting enough although the pizza place was very disorganized (it took 40 minutes for us to get a pizza), but the Chinese breakfast buffet was good value for the cost. There was a great margarita bar upstairs with plenty of different flavours to choose from but the shopping was very limited, as was expected from a relatively small-scale hotel like NYNY.It's connected to the MGM via walkway, so it's location is quite convenient, as you can catch the Monorail from the MGM to take you to most points of interest along the strip. Since we booked our trip with airfare plus hotel, it's hard to say how much the hotel itself cost, but it felt like a pretty good deal, in comparison to some other hotels we were looking at. Especially given it's location, it's definitely a good deal, as you can pay less to stay there but still be nearby to the other big name hotels. We would definitely stay there again!

Sep 24 2008 	Great time. Worth a visit.	This was our first trip to Vegas and had high hopes. We weren't disappointed.NYNY is pretty spectacular, especially from the outside. Its a replica of NY City, with skyscrapers, a mini Brooklyn Bridge and their very own Statue of Liberty.Inside is a large casino and a food court replicating the streets of NY City. There's plenty to eat if you like fast food (i.e. pizzas, bagels, burgers etc). The food was very good, especially the pastrami bagels from the deli.There are some restaurants in the hotel. We tried the Italian (nothing special) and Gallagher's steak house. Be warned, the steaks here are HUGE!!!! There were six of us. None of us were able to eat a whole rib-eye ($35 each). Do the sensible thing, share one.We visted other hotels on the strip - Venitian, Paris, Mirage, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay - and discovered that their malls, casinos and food courts were bigger and, probably, better. But there was something very comforting and relaxing about NYNY. The room we had (Park Avenue) was bigger than we expected and very clean. It had everything we needed.NYNY is at the south end of the strip. Its quite a walk to the hotels and sights further up the strip, especially in the 100 degree heat we experienced. If you need to travel north, we recommend using the Deuce, the 24-hour bus service that runs the length of the strip. Its only $5 for a 24-hour unlimited pass.Sights to take in when you're in Vegas - the Grand Canyon (a must), the Bellagio fountains, the baby lions and dolphin at the Mirage, the light shown at Fremont Street (Downtown).All in all, you'll hopefully find NYNY a great place to stay.

Nov 12 2009 	Loved It	Stayed at Polo towers 1 week. Got strip view on 16th floor which had a balcony. Loved the view and enjoyed the closeness to the strip. A "tix for tonight" booth is right in front on the strip which made getting discount show tickets a breeze. The house keeping cleaned our room everyday which is hard to find in a time share. For light sleepers you can hear Karaoke on the street till 3 am so be warned. Polo towers has one of the best locations on the strip and our stay was great.

Oct 24 2009 	Just average...really really average	First of all, we had a lock off room with a kitchenette and that's never a good idea. Second, we own at the Marriott Grand Chateau next door which is WORLD's better, but wasn't quite finished when we made this trip and our week was a free comp from Marriott for our timeshare purchase. The room was very average and small, but that's because it was the lock off room. It is in a good location, just right off the strip and we only rarely drove or used a cab to get to anything. Service was average at best. Whenever we asked for something it took a while and often, multiple calls, to get what we wanted or needed. You need to know that with most timeshares, check out is 10am and since we didn't get in until 4am the morning we were supposed to check out, we negotiated an additional 2 or 3 hours for an extra $45. We needed the sleep and check out at noon or 1pm was a much better idea. Alas, the front desk called at 9am to verify that we were going to be checking out late. And woke us up. And yes, I was not very pleasant. Then, just as we drifted back off...housekeeping started cleaning the connected room very loudly and then knocked on our door repeatedly and then tried to get in. By the time I pulled the door open, the cleaning lady was running down the hallway, because she realized she'd made a mistake. Not her fault. She wasn't told not to clean our room, but should've been told. I wanted to argue about the $45, but my wife wisely suggested I go get the car and find my peace and she checked us out. Better to write off the money and enjoy the rest of the day. So...my experience was sub-par, but I'd say overall the Polo Towers is a very average hotel and I feel for anyone who buys here with something as nice as the Grand Chateau next door. Oh, and even if you don't stay here (which you shouldn't), check out the three horse sculpture in the lobby. There's something really wrong about it and I think all three horses that posed for the sculpture are going to need some counseling. I'm just saying, it looks...well, it looks wrong. That's all.
